USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

AGSEQ.label: Sequence Number
AGSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

AGGRPID.label: Group ID
AGGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

AGSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
AGSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number from the procedure or test page.

AGLNKID.label: Link ID
AGLNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains.This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.

AGLNKGRP.label: Link Group ID
AGLNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains.This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

AGTRT.label: Reported Agent Name
AGTRT.description: Verbatim medication name that is either preprinted or collected on a CRF.

AGMODIFY.label: Modified Reported Name
AGMODIFY.description: If AGTRT is modified to facilitate coding, then AGMODIFY will contain the modified text.

AGDECOD.label: Standardized Agent Name
AGDECOD.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived text description of AGTRT or AGMODIFY. Equivalent to the generic medication name in WHO Drug. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. If an intervention term does not have a decode value in the dictionary, then AGDECOD will be left blank.

AGCAT.label: Category for Agent
AGCAT.description: Used to define a category of agent. Examples: "CHALLENGE AGENT", "PET TRACER".

AGPRESP.label: AG Pre-Specified
AGPRESP.description: Used to indicate whether ("Y"/null) information about the use of a specific agent was solicited on the CRF.

AGOCCUR.label: AG Occurrence
AGOCCUR.description: When the use of specific agent is solicited, AGOCCUR is used to indicate whether ("Y"/"N") use of the agent occurred. Values are null for agents not specifically solicited.

AGSTAT.label: Completion Status
AGSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a question about a prespecified agent was not answered. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

AGREASND.label: Reason Procedure Agent Not Collected
AGREASND.description: Describes the reason a response to a question about the occurrence of a procedure agent was not collected. Used in conjunction with AGSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

AGCLAS.label: Agent Class
AGCLAS.description: Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class value. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, follow guidance in Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit AGCLAS.

AGCLASCD.label: Agent Class Code
AGCLASCD.description: Class code corresponding to AGCLAS. Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class code. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, follow guidance in Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit AGCLASCD.

AGDOSTXT.label: Dose Description
AGDOSTXT.description: Dosing amounts or a range of dosing information collected in text form. Units may be stored in AGDOSU. Examples: "200-400", "15-20".

AGDOSU.label: Dose Units
AGDOSU.description: Units for AGDOSE and AGDOSTXT. Examples: "ng", "mg", "mg/kg".

AGDOSFRQ.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
AGDOSFRQ.description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of AGDOSE within a specific time period. Example: "ONCE".

AGROUTE.label: Route of Administration
AGROUTE.description: Route of administration for AGTRT. Example: "ORAL".

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: 1. Clinical encounter number. \n 2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: 1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. \n 2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the agent administration started.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the agent administration started.

AGSTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Agent
AGSTDTC.description: The date/time when administration of the treatment indicated by AGTRT and the dosing variables began.

AGENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Agent
AGENDTC.description: The date/time when administration of the treatment indicated by AGTRT and the dosing variables ended.

AGSTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Agent
AGSTDY.description: Study day of start of agent relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

AGENDY.label: Study Day of End of Agent
AGENDY.description: Study day of end of agent relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

AGDUR.label: Duration of Agent
AGDUR.description: Collected duration for an agent episode. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.

AGSTRF.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
AGSTRF.description: Describes the start of the agent relative to sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING", or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into AGSTRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

AGENRF.label: End Relative to Reference Period
AGENRF.description: Describes the end of the agent relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING", or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into AGENRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

AGSTRTPT.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
AGSTRTPT.description: Identifies the start of the agent as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable AGSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

AGSTTPT.label: Start Reference Time Point
AGSTTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by AGSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1".

AGENRTPT.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
AGENRTPT.description: Identifies the end of the agent as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable AGENTPT. Identifies the end of the agent as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable AGENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

AGENTPT.label: End Reference Time Point
AGENTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by AGENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

CMSEQ.label: Sequence Number
CMSEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

CMGRPID.label: Group ID
CMGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

CMSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
CMSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Example: a number preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or record identifier defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: line number on a concomitant medication page.

CMTRT.label: Reported Name of Drug, Med, or Therapy
CMTRT.description: Verbatim medication name that is either preprinted or collected on a CRF.

CMMODIFY.label: Modified Reported Name
CMMODIFY.description: If CMTRT is modified to facilitate coding, then CMMODIFY will contain the modified text.

CMDECOD.label: Standardized Medication Name
CMDECOD.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived text description of CMTRT or CMMODIFY. Equivalent to the generic drug name in WHO Drug. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. If an intervention term does not have a decode value in the dictionary, then CMDECOD will be left blank.

CMCAT.label: Category for Medication
CMCAT.description: Used to define a category of medications/treatment. Examples: "PRIOR", "CONCOMITANT", "ANTI-CANCER MEDICATION", "GENERAL CONMED".

CMSCAT.label: Subcategory for Medication
CMSCAT.description: A further categorization of medications/treatment. Examples: "CHEMOTHERAPY", "HORMONAL THERAPY", "ALTERNATIVE THERAPY".

CMPRESP.label: CM Pre-specified
CMPRESP.description: Used to indicate whether ("Y"/null) information about the use of a specific medication was solicited on the CRF.

CMOCCUR.label: CM Occurrence
CMOCCUR.description: When the use of a specific medication is solicited. CMOCCUR is used to indicate whether ("Y"/"N") use of the medication occurred. Values are null for medications not specifically solicited.

CMSTAT.label: Completion Status
CMSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a question about the occurrence of a prespecified intervention was not answered. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

CMREASND.label: Reason Medication Not Collected
CMREASND.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with CMSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

CMINDC.label: Indication
CMINDC.description: Denotes why a medication was taken or administered. Examples: "NAUSEA", "HYPERTENSION".

CMCLAS.label: Medication Class
CMCLAS.description: Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class value. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, then follow Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit CMCLAS.

CMCLASCD.label: Medication Class Code
CMCLASCD.description: Class code corresponding to CMCLAS. Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class code. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, then follow Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit CMCLASCD.

CMDOSE.label: Dose per Administration
CMDOSE.description: Amount of CMTRT given. Not populated when CMDOSTXT is populated.

CMDOSTXT.label: Dose Description
CMDOSTXT.description: Dosing amounts or a range of dosing information collected in text form. Units may be stored in CMDOSU. Examples: "200-400", "15-20". Not populated when CMDOSE is populated.

CMDOSU.label: Dose Units
CMDOSU.description: Units for CMDOSE, CMDOSTOT, or CMDOSTXT. Examples: "ng", "mg", "mg/kg".

CMDOSFRQ.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
CMDOSFRQ.description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of CMDOSE within a specific time period. Examples: "BID" (twice daily), "Q12H" (every 12 hours).

CMDOSTOT.label: Total Daily Dose
CMDOSTOT.description: Total daily dose of CMTRT using the units in CMDOSU. Used when dosing is collected as total daily dose. Total dose over a period other than day could be recorded in a separate supplemental qualifier variable.

CMDOSRGM.label: Intended Dose Regimen
CMDOSRGM.description: Text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Example: "TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF".

CMROUTE.label: Route of Administration
CMROUTE.description: Route of administration for the intervention. Examples: "ORAL", "INTRAVENOUS".

CMADJ.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
CMADJ.description: Describes reason or explanation of why a dose is adjusted. Examples: "ADVERSE EVENT", "INSUFFICIENT RESPONSE", "NON-MEDICAL REASON".

CMRSDISC.label: Reason the Intervention Was Discontinued
CMRSDISC.description: When dosing of a treatment is recorded over multiple successive records, this variable is applicable only for the (chronologically) last record for the treatment.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the medication administration started. Null for medications that started before study participation.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the medication administration. Null for medications that started before study participation.

CMSTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Medication
CMSTDTC.description: Start date/time of the medication administration represented in ISO 8601 character format.

CMENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Medication
CMENDTC.description: End date/time of the medication administration represented in ISO 8601 character format.

CMSTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Medication
CMSTDY.description: Study day of start of medication relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

CMENDY.label: Study Day of End of Medication
CMENDY.description: Study day of end of medication relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

CMDUR.label: Duration
CMDUR.description: Collected duration for a treatment episode. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.

CMSTRF.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
CMSTRF.description: Describes the start of the medication relative to sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR" was collected, this information may be translated into CMSTRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

CMENRF.label: End Relative to Reference Period
CMENRF.description: Describes the end of the medication relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING, or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into CMENRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

CMSTRTPT.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
CMSTRTPT.description: Identifies the start of the medication as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable CMSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

CMSTTPT.label: Start Reference Time Point
CMSTTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by CMSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1".

CMENRTPT.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
CMENRTPT.description: Identifies the end of the medication as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable CMENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

CMENTPT.label: End Reference Time Point
CMENTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by CMENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

ECSEQ.label: Sequence Number
ECSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

ECGRPID.label: Group ID
ECGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

ECREFID.label: Reference ID
ECREFID.description: Internal or external identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier).

ECSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
ECSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a CRF page.

ECLNKID.label: Link ID
ECLNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains.

ECLNKGRP.label: Link Group ID
ECLNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related, grouped records across domains.

ECTRT.label: Name of Treatment
ECTRT.description: Name of the intervention treatment known to the subject and/or administrator.

ECMOOD.label: Mood
ECMOOD.description: Mode or condition of the record specifying whether the intervention (activity) is intended to happen or has happened. Values align with BRIDG pillars (e.g., scheduled context, performed context) and HL7 activity moods (e.g., intent, event). Examples: "SCHEDULED", "PERFORMED".

ECCAT.label: Category of Treatment
ECCAT.description: Used to define a category of related ECTRT values.

ECSCAT.label: Subcategory of Treatment
ECSCAT.description: A further categorization of ECCAT values.

ECPRESP.label: Pre-Specified
ECPRESP.description: Used when a specific intervention is prespecified. Values should be "Y" or null.

ECOCCUR.label: Occurrence
ECOCCUR.description: Used to indicate whether a treatment occurred when information about the occurrence is solicited. ECOCCUR = "N" when a treatment was not taken, not given, or missed.

ECREASOC.label: Reason for Occur Value
ECREASOC.description: The reason for the value in --OCCUR. If --OCCUR = "N", this is the reason the exposure did not occur.

ECDOSE.label: Dose
ECDOSE.description: Amount of ECTRT when numeric. Not populated when ECDOSTXT is populated.

ECDOSTXT.label: Dose Description
ECDOSTXT.description: Amount of ECTRT when non-numeric. Dosing amounts or a range of dosing information collected in text form. Example: "200-400". Not populated when ECDOSE is populated.

ECDOSU.label: Dose Units
ECDOSU.description: Units for ECDOSE, ECDOSTOT, or ECDOSTXT.

ECDOSFRQ.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
ECDOSFRQ.description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of ECDOSE within a specific time period. Examples: "Q2H", "QD", "BID".

ECDOSTOT.label: Total Daily Dose
ECDOSTOT.description: Total daily dose of ECTRT using the units in ECDOSU. Used when dosing is collected as total daily dose.

ECDOSRGM.label: Intended Dose Regimen
ECDOSRGM.description: Text description of the intended schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Example: "TWO WEEKS ON", "TWO WEEKS OFF".

ECROUTE.label: Route of Administration
ECROUTE.description: Route of administration for the intervention. Examples: "ORAL", "INTRAVENOUS".

ECLOT.label: Lot Number
ECLOT.description: Lot number of the ECTRT product.

ECLAT.label: Laterality
ECLAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing laterality of the intervention administration. Examples: "LEFT", "RIGHT".

ECDIR.label: Directionality
ECDIR.description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL", "UPPER".

ECPORTOT.label: Portion or Totality
ECPORTOT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of). Examples: "ENTIRE", "SINGLE", "SEGMENT".

ECFAST.label: Fasting Status
ECFAST.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Examples: "Y", "N".

ECPSTRG.label: Pharmaceutical Strength
ECPSTRG.description: Amount of an active ingredient expressed quantitatively per dosage unit, per unit of volume, or per unit of weight, according to the pharmaceutical dose form.

ECADJ.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
ECADJ.description: Describes reason or explanation of why a dose is adjusted.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Trial epoch of the exposure as collected record. Examples: "RUN-IN", "TREATMENT".

ECSTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Treatment
ECSTDTC.description: The date/time when administration of the treatment indicated by ECTRT and ECDOSE began.

ECENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Treatment
ECENDTC.description: The date/time when administration of the treatment indicated by ECTRT and ECDOSE ended. For administrations considered given at a point in time (e.g., oral tablet, pre-filled syringe injection), where only an administration date/time is collected, ECSTDTC should be copied to ECENDTC as the standard representation.

ECSTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Treatment
ECSTDY.description: Study day of ECSTDTC relative to the sponsor-defined DM.RFSTDTC.

ECENDY.label: Study Day of End of Treatment
ECENDY.description: Study day of ECENDTC relative to the sponsor-defined DM.RFSTDTC.

ECDUR.label: Duration of Treatment
ECDUR.description: Collected duration of administration. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.

ECTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
ECTPT.description: Text description of time when administration should occur. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See ECTPTNUM and ECTPTREF.

ECTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
ECTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of ECTPT to aid in sorting.

ECELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
ECELTM.description: Planned elapsed time relative to the planned fixed reference (ECTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time.

ECTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
ECTPTREF.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by ECELTM, ECTPTNUM, and ECTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

ECRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
ECRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by ECTPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

EXSEQ.label: Sequence Number
EXSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

EXGRPID.label: Group ID
EXGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

EXREFID.label: Reference ID
EXREFID.description: Internal or external identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier).

EXSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
EXSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a CRF page.

EXLNKID.label: Link ID
EXLNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains.

EXLNKGRP.label: Link Group ID
EXLNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related, grouped records across domains.

EXTRT.label: Name of Treatment
EXTRT.description: Name of the protocol-specified study treatment given during the dosing period for the observation.

EXCAT.label: Category of Treatment
EXCAT.description: Used to define a category of EXTRT values.

EXSCAT.label: Subcategory of Treatment
EXSCAT.description: A further categorization of EXCAT values.

EXDOSE.label: Dose
EXDOSE.description: Amount of EXTRT when numeric. Not populated when EXDOSTXT is populated.

EXDOSTXT.label: Dose Description
EXDOSTXT.description: Amount of EXTRT when non-numeric. Dosing amounts or a range of dosing information collected in text form. Example: "200-400". Not populated when EXDOSE is populated.

EXDOSU.label: Dose Units
EXDOSU.description: Units for EXDOSE, EXDOSTOT, or EXDOSTXT representing protocol-specified values. Examples: "ng", "mg", "mg/kg", "mg/m2".

EXDOSFRQ.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
EXDOSFRQ.description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of EXDOSE within a specific time period. Examples: "Q2H", "QD", "BID".

EXDOSRGM.label: Intended Dose Regimen
EXDOSRGM.description: Text description of the intended schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Example: "TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF".

EXROUTE.label: Route of Administration
EXROUTE.description: Route of administration for the intervention. Examples: "ORAL", "INTRAVENOUS".

EXLOT.label: Lot Number
EXLOT.description: Lot number of the intervention product.

EXLAT.label: Laterality
EXLAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing laterality of the intervention administration. Examples: "LEFT", "RIGHT".

EXDIR.label: Directionality
EXDIR.description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL", "UPPER".

EXFAST.label: Fasting Status
EXFAST.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Examples: "Y", "N".

EXADJ.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
EXADJ.description: Describes reason or explanation of why a dose is adjusted.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Trial epoch of the exposure record. Examples: "RUN-IN", "TREATMENT".

EXSTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Treatment
EXSTDTC.description: The date/time when administration of the treatment indicated by EXTRT and EXDOSE began.

EXENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Treatment
EXENDTC.description: The date/time when administration of the treatment indicated by EXTRT and EXDOSE ended. For administrations considered given at a point in time (e.g., oral tablet, pre-filled syringe injection), where only an administration date/time is collected, EXSTDTC should be copied to EXENDTC as the standard representation.

EXSTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Treatment
EXSTDY.description: Study day of EXSTDTC relative to DM.RFSTDTC.

EXENDY.label: Study Day of End of Treatment
EXENDY.description: Study day of EXENDTC relative to DM.RFSTDTC.

EXDUR.label: Duration of Treatment
EXDUR.description: Collected duration of administration. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.

EXTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
EXTPT.description: Text description of time when administration should occur. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See EXTPTNUM and EXTPTREF.

EXTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
EXTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of EXTPT to aid in sorting.

EXELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
EXELTM.description: Planned elapsed time relative to the planned fixed reference (EXTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time.

EXTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
EXTPTREF.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by EXELTM, EXTPTNUM, and EXTPT. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL.

EXRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
EXRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by EXTPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

MLSEQ.label: Sequence Number
MLSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

MLGRPID.label: Group ID
MLGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

MLSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
MLSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Examples: a number preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier, record identifier defined in the sponsor's operational database.

MLTRT.label: Name of Meal
MLTRT.description: Verbatim food product name that is either preprinted or collected on a CRF.

MLCAT.label: Category for Meal
MLCAT.description: Used to define a category of MLTRT values.

MLSCAT.label: Subcategory for Meal
MLSCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of MLCAT values.

MLPRESP.label: ML Pre-specified
MLPRESP.description: Used when a specific meal is prespecified on a CRF. Values should be "Y" or null.

MLOCCUR.label: ML Occurrence
MLOCCUR.description: Used to record whether a prespecified meal occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific meal is solicited.

MLSTAT.label: Completion Status
MLSTAT.description: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a prespecified meal was not answered. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

MLREASND.label: Reason Meal Not Collected
MLREASND.description: Describes the reason a response to a question about the occurrence of a meal was not collected. Used in conjunction with MLSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

MLDOSE.label: Dose
MLDOSE.description: Amount of MLTRT consumed. Not populated when MLDOSTXT is populated.

MLDOSTXT.label: Dose Description
MLDOSTXT.description: Amount description of MLTRT consumed, collected in text form. Not populated when MLDOSE is populated. Examples: "<1 per day", "200-400".

MLDOSU.label: Dose Units
MLDOSU.description: Units for MLDOSE, MLDOSTOT, or MLDOSTXT.

MLDOSFRM.label: Dose Form
MLDOSFRM.description: Dosage form for MLTRT. Example: "BAR, CHEWABLE".

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the meal started.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the meal.

MLDTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
MLDTC.description: Collection date and time of the meal represented in ISO 8601 character format.

MLSTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Meal
MLSTDTC.description: Start date/time of the meal represented in ISO 8601 character format.

MLENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Meal
MLENDTC.description: End date/time of the meal represented in ISO 8601 character format.

MLDY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
MLDY.description: Actual study day of the visit/collection expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

MLSTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Meal
MLSTDY.description: Actual study day of start of the meal expressed in integer days relative to sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

MLENDY.label: Study Day of End of Meal
MLENDY.description: Actual study day of end of the meal expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

MLDUR.label: Duration of Meal
MLDUR.description: Collected duration of the meal represented in ISO 8601 character format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived.

MLTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
MLTPT.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point. See MLTPTNUM and MLTPTREF.

MLTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
MLTPTNUM.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.

MLELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
MLELTM.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to the planned fixed reference (MLTPTREF). This variable is useful when there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration.

MLTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
MLTPTREF.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by MLELTM, MLTPTNUM, and MLTPT.

MLRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
MLRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by MLTPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.

MIDS.label: Disease Milestone Instance Name
MIDS.description: The name of a specific instance of a disease milestone type (MIDSTYPE) described in the Trial Disease Milestones dataset. This should be unique within a subject. Used only in conjunction with RELMIDS and MIDSDTC.

RELMIDS.label: Temporal Relation to Milestone Instance
RELMIDS.description: The temporal relationship of the observation to the disease milestone instance name in MIDS. Examples: "IMMEDIATELY BEFORE", "AT TIME OF", "AFTER".

MIDSDTC.label: Disease Milestone Instance Date/Time
MIDSDTC.description: The start date/time of the disease milestone instance name in MIDS, in ISO 8601 format.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

PRSEQ.label: Sequence Number
PRSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

PRGRPID.label: Group ID
PRGRPID.description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

PRSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
PRSPID.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: preprinted line identifier on a CRF, record identifier defined in the sponsor's operational database.

PRLNKID.label: Link ID
PRLNKID.description: Used to facilitate identification of relationships between records.

PRLNKGRP.label: Link Group ID
PRLNKGRP.description: Used to facilitate identification of relationships between records.

PRTRT.label: Reported Name of Procedure
PRTRT.description: Name of procedure performed, either preprinted or collected on a CRF.

PRDECOD.label: Standardized Procedure Name
PRDECOD.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived name of PRTRT. If the codelist "PROCEDUR" is not used, the sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms in the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. If an intervention term does not have a decode value, then PRDECOD will be null.

PRCAT.label: Category
PRCAT.description: Used to define a category of procedure values.

PRSCAT.label: Subcategory
PRSCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of PRCAT values.

PRPRESP.label: Pre-specified
PRPRESP.description: Used when a specific procedure is pre-specified on a CRF. Values should be "Y" or null.

PROCCUR.label: Occurrence
PROCCUR.description: Used to record whether a prespecified procedure occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific procedure is solicited.

PRINDC.label: Indication
PRINDC.description: Denotes the indication for the procedure (e.g., why the procedure was performed).

PRDOSE.label: Dose
PRDOSE.description: Amount of PRTRT administered. Not populated when PRDOSTXT is populated.

PRDOSTXT.label: Dose Description
PRDOSTXT.description: Dosing information collected in text form. Examples: "<1", "200-400". Not populated when PRDOSE is populated.

PRDOSU.label: Dose Units
PRDOSU.description: Units for PRDOSE, PRDOSTOT, or PRDOSTXT.

PRDOSFRQ.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
PRDOSFRQ.description: Usually expressed as the number of doses given per a specific interval.

PRDOSRGM.label: Intended Dose Regimen
PRDOSRGM.description: Text description of the intended schedule or regimen for the procedure.

PRLAT.label: Laterality
PRLAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality.

PRDIR.label: Directionality
PRDIR.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality.

PRPORTOT.label: Portion or Totality
PRPORTOT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the procedure.

PRSTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Procedure
PRSTDTC.description: Start date/time of the procedure represented in ISO 8601 character format.

PRENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Procedure
PRENDTC.description: End date/time of the procedure represented in ISO 8601 character format.

PRSTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Procedure
PRSTDY.description: Study day of start of procedure expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

PRENDY.label: Study Day of End of Procedure
PRENDY.description: Study day of end of procedure expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

PRDUR.label: Duration of Procedure
PRDUR.description: Collected duration of a procedure represented in ISO 8601 character format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.

PRTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
PRTPT.description: Text description of time when a procedure should be performed. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See PRTPTNUM and PRTPTREF.

PRTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
PRTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of planned time point used in sorting.

PRELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
PRELTM.description: Planned elapsed time in ISO 8601 format relative to a planned fixed reference (PRTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.

PRTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
PRTPTREF.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by PRELTM, PRTPTNUM, and PRTPT.

PRRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
PRRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by PRTRTREF in ISO 8601 character format.

PRSTRTPT.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
PRSTRTPT.description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable PRSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

PRSTTPT.label: Start Reference Time Point
PRSTTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by PRSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1".

PRENRTPT.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
PRENRTPT.description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable PRENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

PRENTPT.label: End Reference Time Point
PRENTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by PRENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

SUSEQ.label: Sequence Number
SUSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

SUGRPID.label: Group ID
SUGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

SUSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SUSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a Tobacco & Alcohol Use CRF page.

SUMODIFY.label: Modified Substance Name
SUMODIFY.description: If SUTRT is modified, then the modified text is placed here.

SUDECOD.label: Standardized Substance Name
SUDECOD.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived text description of SUTRT or SUMODIFY if the sponsor chooses to code the substance use. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.

SUCAT.label: Category for Substance Use
SUCAT.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "TOBACCO", "ALCOHOL", or "CAFFEINE".

SUSCAT.label: Subcategory for Substance Use
SUSCAT.description: A further categorization of substance use. Examples: "CIGARS", "CIGARETTES", "BEER", "WINE".

SUPRESP.label: SU Pre-Specified
SUPRESP.description: Used to indicate whether ("Y"/null) information about the use of a specific substance was solicited on the CRF.

SUOCCUR.label: SU Occurrence
SUOCCUR.description: When the use of specific substances is solicited, SUOCCUR is used to indicate whether ("Y"/"N") a particular prespecified substance was used. Values are null for substances not specifically solicited.

SUSTAT.label: Completion Status
SUSTAT.description: When the use of prespecified substances is solicited, the completion status indicates that there was no response to the question about the prespecified substance. When there is no prespecified list on the CRF, then the completion status indicates that substance use was not assessed for the subject.

SUREASND.label: Reason Substance Use Not Collected
SUREASND.description: Describes the reason substance use was not collected. Used in conjunction with SUSTAT when value of SUSTAT is "NOT DONE".

SUCLAS.label: Substance Use Class
SUCLAS.description: Substance use class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class value. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, then follow Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit SUCLAS.

SUCLASCD.label: Substance Use Class Code
SUCLASCD.description: Code corresponding to SUCLAS. May be obtained from coding.

SUDOSE.label: Substance Use Consumption
SUDOSE.description: Amount of SUTRT consumed. Not populated if SUDOSTXT is populated.

SUDOSTXT.label: Substance Use Consumption Text
SUDOSTXT.description: Substance use consumption amounts or a range of consumption information collected in text form. Not populated if SUDOSE is populated.

SUDOSU.label: Consumption Units
SUDOSU.description: Units for SUDOSE, SUDOSTOT, or SUDOSTXT. Examples: "oz", "CIGARETTE", "PACK", "g".

SUDOSFRQ.label: Use Frequency Per Interval
SUDOSFRQ.description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of SUDOSE within a specific time period. Example: "Q24H" (every day).

SUDOSTOT.label: Total Daily Consumption
SUDOSTOT.description: Total daily use of SUTRT using the units in SUDOSU. Used when dosing is collected as total daily dose. If a sponsor needs to aggregate the data over a period other than daily, then the aggregated total could be recorded in a supplemental qualifier variable.

SUROUTE.label: Route of Administration
SUROUTE.description: Route of administration for SUTRT. Examples: "ORAL", "INTRAVENOUS".

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the substance use started. Null for substances that started before study participation.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the substance use. Null for substances that started before study participation.

SUSTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Substance Use
SUSTDTC.description: Start date/time of the substance use represented in ISO 8601 character format.

SUENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Substance Use
SUENDTC.description: End date/time of the substance use represented in ISO 8601 character format.

SUSTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Substance Use
SUSTDY.description: Study day of start of substance use relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

SUENDY.label: Study Day of End of Substance Use
SUENDY.description: Study day of end of substance use relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

SUDUR.label: Duration of Substance Use
SUDUR.description: Collected duration of substance use in ISO 8601 format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.

SUSTRF.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
SUSTRF.description: Describes the start of the substance use relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR" was collected, this information may be translated into SUSTRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

SUENRF.label: End Relative to Reference Period
SUENRF.description: Describes the end of the substance use with relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING", or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into SUENRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

SUSTRTPT.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
SUSTRTPT.description: Identifies the start of the substance as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable SUSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7 , Use of Relative Timing Variables.

SUSTTPT.label: Start Reference Time Point
SUSTTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by SUSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1".

SUENRTPT.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
SUENRTPT.description: Identifies the end of the substance as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable SUENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7 , Use of Relative Timing Variables.

SUENTPT.label: End Reference Time Point
SUENTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by SUENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

SPDEVID.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
SPDEVID.description: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify a specific device. Used to represent a device associated in some way with the adverse event. SPDEVID values are defined in the Device Identifiers (DI) domain.

AESEQ.label: Sequence Number
AESEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

AEGRPID.label: Group ID
AEGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

AEREFID.label: Reference ID
AEREFID.description: Internal or external identifier such as a serial number on an SAE reporting form.

AESPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
AESPID.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. It may be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on an Adverse Events CRF page.

AETERM.label: Reported Term for the Adverse Event

AEMODIFY.label: Modified Reported Term
AEMODIFY.description: If AETERM is modified to facilitate coding, then AEMODIFY will contain the modified text.

AELLT.label: Lowest Level Term
AELLT.description: Dictionary-derived text description of the lowest level term.

AELLTCD.label: Lowest Level Term Code
AELLTCD.description: Dictionary-derived code for the lowest level term.

AEDECOD.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
AEDECOD.description: Dictionary-derived text description of AETERM or AEMODIFY. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.

AEPTCD.label: Preferred Term Code
AEPTCD.description: Dictionary-derived code for the preferred term.

AEHLT.label: High Level Term
AEHLT.description: Dictionary-derived text description of the high level term for the primary system organ class (SOC).

AEHLTCD.label: High Level Term Code
AEHLTCD.description: Dictionary-derived code for the high level term for the primary SOC.

AEHLGT.label: High Level Group Term
AEHLGT.description: Dictionary-derived text description of the high level group term for the primary SOC.

AEHLGTCD.label: High Level Group Term Code
AEHLGTCD.description: Dictionary-derived code for the high level group term for the primary SOC.

AECAT.label: Category for Adverse Event
AECAT.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "BLEEDING", "NEUROPSYCHIATRIC".

AESCAT.label: Subcategory for Adverse Event
AESCAT.description: A further categorization of adverse event. Example: "NEUROLOGIC".

AEPRESP.label: Pre-Specified Adverse Event
AEPRESP.description: A value of "Y" indicates that this adverse event was prespecified on the CRF. Values are null for spontaneously reported events (i.e., those collected as free-text verbatim terms).

AEBODSYS.label: Body System or Organ Class
AEBODSYS.description: Dictionary derived. Body system or organ class used by the sponsor from the coding dictionary (e.g., MedDRA). When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables, which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.

AEBDSYCD.label: Body System or Organ Class Code
AEBDSYCD.description: Dictionary derived. Code for the body system or organ class used by the sponsor. When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables, which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.

AESOC.label: Primary System Organ Class
AESOC.description: Dictionary-derived text description of the primary SOC. Will be the same as AEBODSYS if the primary SOC was used for analysis.

AESOCCD.label: Primary System Organ Class Code
AESOCCD.description: Dictionary-derived code for the primary SOC. Will be the same as AEBDSYCD if the primary SOC was used for analysis.

AELOC.label: Location of Event
AELOC.description: Describes anatomical location relevant for the event (e.g., "ARM" for skin rash).

AESEV.label: Severity/Intensity
AESEV.description: The severity or intensity of the event. Examples: "MILD", "MODERATE", "SEVERE".

AESER.label: Serious Event
AESER.description: Is this a serious event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

AEACN.label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
AEACN.description: Describes changes to the study treatment as a result of the event. AEACN is specifically for the relationship to study treatment. AEACNOTH is for actions unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Examples of AEACN values include ICH E2B values: "DRUG WITHDRAWN", "DOSE REDUCED", "DOSE INCREASED", "DOSE NOT CHANGED", "UNKNOWN" and "NOT APPLICABLE".

AEACNOTH.label: Other Action Taken
AEACNOTH.description: Describes other actions taken as a result of the event that are unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Usually reported as free text. Example: "TREATMENT UNBLINDED. PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN NOTIFIED".

AEACNDEV.label: Action Taken with Device
AEACNDEV.description: An action taken with a device as the result of the event. The device may or may not be a device under study.

AEREL.label: Causality
AEREL.description: Records the investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event to the treatment. ICH does not establish any required or recommended terms for non-device relatedness. ICH E2A and E2B examples include (up-cased here for alignment to SDTM conventions) terms such as "NOT RELATED", "UNLIKELY RELATED", "POSSIBLY RELATED", "RELATED", but these example terms do not establish any conventions or expectations. Controlled terminology may be defined in the future. Check with regulatory authority for population of this variable.

AERLDEV.label: Relationship of Event to Device
AERLDEV.description:
A judgment as to the likelihood that the device caused the adverse event. The relationship is to a device identified in the data (i.e., has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. 
 Terminology: 
 * In the EU, follow the European Commission Guidelines on Medical Devices, Clinical Investigations: SAE Reporting (MEDDEV 2.7/3) (e.g., Not Related, Unlikely, Possible, Probable, Causal Relationship), with device-specific definitions. 
 * No required Controlled Terminology in US.

AERELNST.label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
AERELNST.description: Records the investigator's opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study drug. May be reported as free text. Example: "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE".

AEPATT.label: Pattern of Adverse Event
AEPATT.description: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time. Examples: "INTERMITTENT", "CONTINUOUS", "SINGLE EVENT".

AEOUT.label: Outcome of Adverse Event
AEOUT.description: Description of the outcome of an event.

AESCAN.label: Involves Cancer
AESCAN.description: Was the serious event associated with the development of cancer? Valid values are "Y" and "N". This is a legacy seriousness criterion. It is not included in ICH E2A or E2B.

AESCONG.label: Congenital Anomaly or Birth Defect
AESCONG.description: Was the serious event associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

AESDISAB.label: Persist or Signif Disability/Incapacity
AESDISAB.description: Did the serious event result in persistent or significant disability/incapacity? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

AESDTH.label: Results in Death
AESDTH.description: Did the serious event result in death? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

AESHOSP.label: Requires or Prolongs Hospitalization
AESHOSP.description: Did the serious event require or prolong hospitalization? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

AESLIFE.label: Is Life Threatening
AESLIFE.description: Was the serious event life-threatening? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

AESOD.label: Occurred with Overdose
AESOD.description: Did the serious event occur with an overdose? Valid values are "Y" and "N". This is a legacy seriousness criterion. It is not included in ICH E2A or E2B.

AESMIE.label: Other Medically Important Serious Event
AESMIE.description: Do additional categories for seriousness apply? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

AESINTV.label: Needs Intervention to Prevent Impairment
AESINTV.description: Records whether medical or surgical intervention was necessary to preclude permanent impairment of a body function, or to prevent permanent damage to a body structure, with either situation suspected to be due to the use of a medical product. This variable is used in conjunction with the other "seriousness" variables (e.g., fatal, life-threatening). It is part of the US federal government definition of a serious adverse event; see 21 CFR Part 803.3(w)(3).

AEUNANT.label: Unanticipated Adverse Device Effect
AEUNANT.description:
Any serious adverse effect on health or safety or any life-threatening problem or death caused by or associated with a device, if that effect, problem, or death was not previously identified in nature, severity, or degree of incidence in the investigational plan or application (including a supplementary plan or application), 
 or 
 any other unanticipated serious problem associated with a device that relates to the rights, safety, or welfare of subjects. (21 CFR Part 812.3(s)). 
 This variable applies only to serious AEs and should hold collected data; if the value is derived, it should be held in ADaM.

AERLPRT.label: Rel of AE to Non-Dev-Rel Study Activity
AERLPRT.description:
The investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event as related to other protocol-required activities, actions, or assessments (e.g., medication changes, tests/assessments, other procedures). The relationship is to a protocol-specified, non-device-related activity where the device is identified in the data (i.e., has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. 
 Terminology: 
 * In the EU, follow the European Commission Guidelines on Medical Devices, Clinical Investigations: SAE Reporting (MEDDEV 2.7/3) (e.g., Not Related, Unlikely, Possible, Probable, Causal Relationship), with device-specific definitions. 
 * No required Controlled Terminology in US.

AERLPRC.label: Rel of AE to Device-Related Procedure
AERLPRC.description:
The investigator's opinion as to the likelihood that the device-related study procedure (e.g., implant/insertion, revision/adjustment, explant/removal) caused the AE. The relationship is to a device-related procedure where the device is identified in the data (i.e., has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. 
 Terminology: 
 * In the EU, follow the European Commission Guidelines on Medical Devices, Clinical Investigations: SAE Reporting (MEDDEV 2.7/3) (e.g., Not Related, Unlikely, Possible, Probable, Causal Relationship), with device-specific definitions. 
 * No required Controlled Terminology in US.

AECONTRT.label: Concomitant or Additional Trtmnt Given
AECONTRT.description: Was another treatment given because of the occurrence of the event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".

AETOXGR.label: Standard Toxicity Grade
AETOXGR.description: Toxicity grade according to a standard toxicity scale (e.g., Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events, CTCAE). Sponsors should specify the name of the scale and version used in the metadata (see assumption 7d). If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., "2", not "Grade 2").

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the adverse event. Examples: "SCREENING", "TREATMENT", "FOLLOW-UP".

AESTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Adverse Event
AESTDTC.description: Start date/time of the adverse event represented in ISO 8601 character format.

AEENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Adverse Event
AEENDTC.description: End date/time of the adverse event represented in ISO 8601 character format.

AESTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Adverse Event
AESTDY.description: Study day of start of adverse event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

AEENDY.label: Study Day of End of Adverse Event
AEENDY.description: Study day of end of event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

AEDUR.label: Duration of Adverse Event
AEDUR.description: Collected duration and unit of an adverse event. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times. Example: "P1DT2H" (for 1 day, 2 hours).

AEENRF.label: End Relative to Reference Period
AEENRF.description: Describes the end of the event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point (RFSTDTC) and a discrete ending point (RFENDTC) of the trial. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

AEENRTPT.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
AEENRTPT.description: Identifies the end of the event as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable AEENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

AEENTPT.label: End Reference Time Point
AEENTPT.description: Description of date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by AEENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

BESEQ.label: Sequence Number
BESEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.

BEGRPID.label: Group ID
BEGRPID.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

BEREFID.label: Reference ID
BEREFID.description: Internal or external identifier for the specimen affected or created by the event.

BESPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
BESPID.description: Optional sponsor-defined reference number. Example: Line number on a CRF page.

BETERM.label: Reported Term for the Biospecimen Event
BETERM.description: Topic variable for an event observation, which is the verbatim or pre-specified name of the event.

BEMODIFY.label: Modified Reported Term
BEMODIFY.description: If the value for BETERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

BEDECOD.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
BEDECOD.description: Dictionary-derived text description of BETERM or BEMODIFY, if applicable.

BECAT.label: Category for Biospecimen Event
BECAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: COLLECTION, PREPARATION, TRANSPORT.

BESCAT.label: Subcategory for Biospecimen Event
BESCAT.description: A further categorization of BECAT values.

BELOC.label: Anatomical Location of Event
BELOC.description: Describes the anatomical location relevant for the event (e.g. BRAIN, LUNG).

BEPARTY.label: Accountable Party
BEPARTY.description: Party accountable for the transferable object (e.g. specimen) as a result of the activity performed in the associated BETERM variable. The party could be an individual (e.g., subject), an organization (e.g., sponsor), or a location that is a proxy for an individual or organization (e.g., site). It is usually a somewhat general term that is further identified in the BEPRTYID variable.

BEPRTYID.label: Identification of Accountable Party
BEPRTYID.description: Identification of the specific party accountable for the transferable object (e.g. Specimen) after the action in BETERM is taken. Used in conjunction with BEPARTY.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

BEDTC.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
BEDTC.description: Date and time of specimen collection.

BESTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Biospecimen Event
BESTDY.description: Actual study day of start of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

BEENDY.label: Study Day of End of Biospecimen Event
BEENDY.description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

BEDUR.label: Duration of Biospecimen Event
BEDUR.description: Collected duration and unit of a biospecimen event. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

CESEQ.label: Sequence Number
CESEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

CEGRPID.label: Group ID
CEGRPID.description: Used to link together a block of related records for a subject within a domain.

CEREFID.label: Reference ID
CEREFID.description: Internal or external identifier (e.g., lab specimen ID, UUID for an ECG waveform or medical image).

CETERM.label: Reported Term for the Clinical Event
CETERM.description: Term for the medical condition or event. Most likely preprinted on CRF.

CEDECOD.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
CEDECOD.description: Controlled terminology for the name of the clinical event. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.

CECAT.label: Category for the Clinical Event
CECAT.description: Used to define a category of related records.

CESCAT.label: Subcategory for the Clinical Event
CESCAT.description: A further categorization of the condition or event.

CEPRESP.label: Clinical Event Pre-specified
CEPRESP.description: Used to indicate whether the event in CETERM was prespecified. Value is "Y" for prespecified events and null for spontaneously reported events.

CEOCCUR.label: Clinical Event Occurrence
CEOCCUR.description: Used when the occurrence of specific events is solicited, to indicate whether or not a clinical event occurred. Values are null for spontaneously reported events.

CESTAT.label: Completion Status
CESTAT.description: The status indicates that a question from a prespecified list was not answered.

CEREASND.label: Reason Clinical Event Not Collected
CEREASND.description: Describes the reason clinical event data was not collected. Used in conjunction with CESTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

CEBODSYS.label: Body System or Organ Class
CEBODSYS.description: Dictionary-derived. Body system or organ class that is involved in an event or measurement from a standard hierarchy (e.g., MedDRA). When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables, which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.

CESEV.label: Severity/Intensity
CESEV.description: The severity or intensity of the event. Examples: "MILD", "MODERATE", "SEVERE".

CETOXGR.label: Standard Toxicity Grade
CETOXGR.description: Toxicity grade according to a standard toxicity scale (e.g., Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v3.0). Sponsor should specify name of the scale and version used in the metadata. If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., "2", not "Grade 2").

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the clinical event started.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the clinical event.

CEDTC.label: Date/Time of Event Collection
CEDTC.description: Collection date and time for the clinical event observation represented in ISO 8601 character format.

CESTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Clinical Event
CESTDTC.description: Start date/time of the clinical event represented in ISO 8601 character format.

CEENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Clinical Event
CEENDTC.description: End date/time of the clinical event, represented in ISO 8601 character format.

CEDY.label: Study Day of Event Collection
CEDY.description: Study day of clinical event collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.

CESTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Event
CESTDY.description: Actual study day of start of the clinical event expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

CEENDY.label: Study Day of End of Event
CEENDY.description: Actual study day of end of the clinical event expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

CESTRF.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
CESTRF.description: Describes the start of the clinical event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

CEENRF.label: End Relative to Reference Period
CEENRF.description: Describes the end of the event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

CESTRTPT.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
CESTRTPT.description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable CESTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

CESTTPT.label: Start Reference Time Point
CESTTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --STRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1".

CEENRTPT.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
CEENRTPT.description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable CEENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

CEENTPT.label: End Reference Time Point
CEENTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by CEENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

DSSEQ.label: Sequence Number
DSSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

DSGRPID.label: Group ID
DSGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

DSSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
DSSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a Disposition page.

DSTERM.label: Reported Term for the Disposition Event
DSTERM.description: Verbatim name of the event or protocol milestone. Some terms in DSTERM will match DSDECOD, but others, such as "Subject moved", will map to controlled terminology in DSDECOD, such as "LOST TO FOLLOW-UP".

DSDECOD.label: Standardized Disposition Term
DSDECOD.description: Controlled terminology for the name of disposition event or protocol milestone. Examples of protocol milestones: "INFORMED CONSENT OBTAINED", "RANDOMIZED". There are separate codelists used for DSDECOD where the choice depends on the value of DSCAT. Codelist "NCOMPLT" is used for disposition events, codelist "PROTMLST" is used for protocol milestones, and codelist "OTHEVENT" is used for other events.

DSCAT.label: Category for Disposition Event
DSCAT.description: Used to define a category of related records.

DSSCAT.label: Subcategory for Disposition Event
DSSCAT.description: A further categorization of DSCAT (e.g., "STUDY PARTICIPATION", "STUDY TREATMENT" when DSCAT = "DISPOSITION EVENT"). The variable may be subject to controlled terminology for other categories of disposition event records.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the event.

DSDTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
DSDTC.description: Collection date and time of the disposition observation represented in ISO 8601 character format.

DSSTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Disposition Event
DSSTDTC.description: Start date/time of the disposition event in ISO 8601 character format.

DSDY.label: Study Day of Collection
DSDY.description: Study day of collection of event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

DSSTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Disposition Event
DSSTDY.description: Study day of start of event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

DVSEQ.label: Sequence Number
DVSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

DVSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
DVSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a CRF page.

DVTERM.label: Protocol Deviation Term
DVTERM.description: Verbatim name of the protocol deviation criterion. Example: "IVRS PROCESS DEVIATION - NO DOSE CALL PERFORMED". DVTERM values will map to the controlled terminology in DVDECOD (e.g., "TREATMENT DEVIATION").

DVDECOD.label: Protocol Deviation Coded Term
DVDECOD.description: Controlled terminology for the name of the protocol deviation. Examples: "SUBJECT NOT WITHDRAWN AS PER PROTOCOL", "SELECTION CRITERIA NOT MET", "EXCLUDED CONCOMITANT MEDICATION", "TREATMENT DEVIATION".

DVCAT.label: Category for Protocol Deviation
DVCAT.description: Category of the protocol deviation criterion.

DVSCAT.label: Subcategory for Protocol Deviation
DVSCAT.description: A further categorization of the protocol deviation.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the deviation. Examples: "TREATMENT", "SCREENING", "FOLLOW-UP".

DVSTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Deviation
DVSTDTC.description: Start date/time of deviation represented in ISO 8601 character format.

DVENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Deviation
DVENDTC.description: End date/time of deviation represented in ISO 8601 character format.

DVSTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Deviation Event
DVSTDY.description: Study day of start of event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

DVENDY.label: Study Day of End of Deviation Event
DVENDY.description: Study day of end of event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

HOSEQ.label: Sequence Number
HOSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

HOGRPID.label: Group ID
HOGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

HOREFID.label: Reference ID
HOREFID.description: Internal or external healthcare encounter identifier.

HOSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
HOSPID.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a Healthcare Encounters CRF page.

HOTERM.label: Healthcare Encounter Term
HOTERM.description: Verbatim or preprinted CRF term for the healthcare encounter.

HODECOD.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
HODECOD.description: Dictionary or sponsor-defined derived text description of HOTERM or the modified topic variable (HOMODIFY).

HOCAT.label: Category for Healthcare Encounter
HOCAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-related values.

HOSCAT.label: Subcategory for Healthcare Encounter
HOSCAT.description: A further categorization of HOCAT values.

HOPRESP.label: Pre-Specified Healthcare Encounter
HOPRESP.description: A value of "Y" indicates that this healthcare encounter event was prespecified on the CRF. Values are null for spontaneously reported events (i.e., those collected as free-text verbatim terms).

HOOCCUR.label: Healthcare Encounter Occurrence
HOOCCUR.description: Used when the occurrence of specific healthcare encounters is solicited, to indicate whether an encounter occurred. Values are null for spontaneously reported events.

HOSTAT.label: Completion Status
HOSTAT.description: The status indicates that the prespecified question was not answered.

HOREASND.label: Reason Healthcare Encounter Not Done
HOREASND.description: Describes the reason data for a prespecified event were not collected. Used in conjunction with HOSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the healthcare encounter. Examples: "SCREENING", "TREATMENT", "FOLLOW-UP".

HODTC.label: Date/Time of Event Collection
HODTC.description: Collection date and time of the healthcare encounter.

HOSTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Healthcare Encounter
HOSTDTC.description: Start date/time of the healthcare encounter (e.g., date of admission).

HOENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Healthcare Encounter
HOENDTC.description: End date/time of the healthcare encounter (e.g., date of discharge).

HODY.label: Study Day of Event Collection
HODY.description: Study day of event collection relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

HOSTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Encounter
HOSTDY.description: Study day of the start of the healthcare encounter relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

HOENDY.label: Study Day of End of Healthcare Encounter
HOENDY.description: Study day of the end of the healthcare encounter relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

HODUR.label: Duration of Healthcare Encounter
HODUR.description: Collected duration of the healthcare encounter. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from the start and end date/times. Example: "P1DT2H" (for 1 day, 2 hours).

HOSTRTPT.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
HOSTRTPT.description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --STTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

HOSTTPT.label: Start Reference Time Point
