HOSTTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by STRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1".

HOENRTPT.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
HOENRTPT.description: Identifies the end of the event as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable HOENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

HOENTPT.label: End Reference Time Point
HOENTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by HOENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

MHSEQ.label: Sequence Number
MHSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

MHGRPID.label: Group ID
MHGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

MHREFID.label: Reference ID
MHREFID.description: Internal or external medical history identifier.

MHSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
MHSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a Medical History CRF page.

MHTERM.label: Reported Term for the Medical History
MHTERM.description: Verbatim or preprinted CRF term for the medical condition or event.

MHMODIFY.label: Modified Reported Term
MHMODIFY.description: If MHTERM is modified to facilitate coding, then MHMODIFY will contain the modified text.

MHDECOD.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
MHDECOD.description: Dictionary-derived text description of MHTERM or MHMODIFY. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.

MHEVDTYP.label: Medical History Event Date Type
MHEVDTYP.description: Specifies the aspect of the medical condition or event by which MHSTDTC and/or the MHENDTC is defined. Examples: "DIAGNOSIS", "SYMPTOMS", "RELAPSE", "INFECTION".

MHCAT.label: Category for Medical History
MHCAT.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "CARDIAC", "GENERAL".

MHSCAT.label: Subcategory for Medical History
MHSCAT.description: A further categorization of the condition or event.

MHPRESP.label: Medical History Event Pre-Specified
MHPRESP.description: A value of "Y" indicates that this medical history event was prespecified on the CRF. Values are null for spontaneously reported events (i.e., those collected as free-text verbatim terms).

MHOCCUR.label: Medical History Occurrence
MHOCCUR.description: Used when the occurrence of specific medical history conditions is solicited, to indicate whether ("Y"/"N") a medical condition (MHTERM) had ever occurred. Values are null for spontaneously reported events.

MHSTAT.label: Completion Status
MHSTAT.description: The status indicates that the prespecified question was not asked/answered.

MHREASND.label: Reason Medical History Not Collected
MHREASND.description: Describes the reason why data for a prespecified condition was not collected. Used in conjunction with MHSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

MHBODSYS.label: Body System or Organ Class
MHBODSYS.description: Dictionary-derived. Body system or organ class that is involved in an event or measurement from a standard hierarchy (e.g., MedDRA). When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the medical history event.

MHDTC.label: Date/Time of History Collection
MHDTC.description: Collection date and time of the medical history observation represented in ISO 8601 character format.

MHSTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Medical History Event
MHSTDTC.description: Start date/time of the medical history event represented in ISO 8601 character format.

MHENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Medical History Event
MHENDTC.description: End date/time of the medical history event.

MHDY.label: Study Day of History Collection
MHDY.description: Study day of medical history collection, measured as integer day. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.

MHENRF.label: End Relative to Reference Period
MHENRF.description: Describes the end of the event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

MHENRTPT.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
MHENRTPT.description: Identifies the end of the event as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable MHENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

MHENTPT.label: End Reference Time Point
MHENTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by MHENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

BSSEQ.label: Sequence Number
BSSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.

BSGRPID.label: Group ID
BSGRPID.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

BSREFID.label: Reference ID
BSREFID.description: Internal or external identifier such as lab specimen ID.

BSTESTCD.label: Biospecimen Test Short Name
BSTESTCD.description: Short character value for BSTEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters. Examples: VOLUME, RIN.

BSTEST.label: Biospecimen Test Name
BSTEST.description: Long name for BSTESTCD. Examples: Volume, RNA Integrity Number.

BSCAT.label: Category for Biospecimen Test
BSCAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: MEASUREMENT, QUALITY.

BSSCAT.label: Subcategory for Biospecimen Test
BSSCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of BSCAT values.

BSORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
BSORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

BSORRESU.label: Original Units
BSORRESU.description: Unit for BSORRES. Examples: mg, mL.

BSSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
BSSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from BSORRES in a standard format or standard units. BSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in BSSTRESN.

BSSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
BSSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from BSSTRESC. BSSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

BSSTRESU.label: Standard Units
BSSTRESU.description: Standardized unit used for BSSTRESC and BSSTRESN.

BSSTAT.label: Completion Status
BSSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a test was not done, or was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.

BSREASND.label: Reason Test Not Done
BSREASND.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with BSSTAT when value is NOT DONE.

BSNAM.label: Vendor Name
BSNAM.description: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

BSSPEC.label: Specimen Type
BSSPEC.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: SERUM, PLASMA, URINE, SOFT TISSUE.

BSANTREG.label: Anatomical Region of Specimen
BSANTREG.description: Defines the specific anatomical or biological region of a tissue, organ specimen or the region from which the specimen is obtained, as defined in the protocol, such as a section or part of what is described in the BSSPEC variable. Examples: CORTEX, MEDULLA, MUCOSA.

BSSPCCND.label: Specimen Condition
BSSPCCND.description: Defines the condition of the specimen. Examples: HEMOLYZED, ICTERIC, LIPEMIC.

BSMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
BSMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: SPECTROPHOTOMETRY, ELECTROPHORESIS.

BSBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
BSBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

BSDTC.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
BSDTC.description: Date and time of specimen collection.

BSDY.label: Study Day of Specimen Collection
BSDY.description: Study day of specimen collection relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

BSTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
BSTPT.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See BSTPTNUM and BSTPTREF.

BSTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
BSTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of BSTPT used in sorting.

BSELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
BSELTM.description: Elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (BSTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.

BSTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
BSTPTREF.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by BSELTM, BSTPTNUM, and BSTPT. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL.

BSRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
BSRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by BSTPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

CPSEQ.label: Sequence Number
CPSEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

CPGRPID.label: Group ID
CPGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

CPSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
CPSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on the lab page.

CPLNKID.label: Link ID
CPLNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.

CPLNKGRP.label: Link Group ID
CPLNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

CPTESTCD.label: Test or Examination Short Name
CPTESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in CPTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in CPTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). CPTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "MONO", "MNS".

CPTEST.label: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination
CPTEST.description: Long name for CPTESTCD. For cell phenotyping, the name (often abbreviated) of the cell population, as it is generally accepted by the scientific community, is populated (rather than a colloquial designation based on a primary marker, e.g., TLym Help rather than CD4). When the test is for a sublineage which can only be identified by specifying additional markers (i.e., has not been given a name) or which is further restricted to a subpopulation based on a particular cell state (e.g., activated, proliferating, apoptotic), the Sublineage Marker String (CPSBMRKS), Cell State (CPCELSTA), and Cell State Marker String (CPCSMRKS) variables are additionally populated and the value in CPTEST is suffixed with "Sub" to denote that it is a subset of the population identified in CPTEST (e.g., Monocytes Sub). \n The value in CPTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters.

CPSBMRKS.label: Sublineage Marker String
CPSBMRKS.description: Used to further subset the cell population identified in CPTEST based on the use of additional marker(s) that define a sublineage. The value in CPSBMRKS is used in combination with values in CPTEST and CPCELSTA to fully describe the cell population being measured. As such, it is an essential component of the full test name. \n For example, three unnamed sublineages of monocytes have been identified as: CCR2+CD16-, CCR2-CD16+, and CCR2+CD16+. Whereas the entire monocyte cell population can be defined as CD14+ cells, the additional CCR2 and CD16 markers are used to differentiate one sublineage from another. As none of these sublineages have been given names, they are only known by the CCR2 and CD16 marker combinations. By associating the CPTEST value of "Monocytes Sub" with, for example, a value of "CCR2+CD16-" in CPSBMRKS, the full test is defined to be the CCR2+CD16- monocyte subpopulation.

CPCELSTA.label: Cell State
CPCELSTA.description: A textual description of a subset of the cell population identified in CPTEST based on a particular functional and/or biological state (e.g., "ACTIVATED", "PROLIFERATING", "SENESCENT"). When populated, the values in CPCELSTA and CPSMRKS, in combination with the values in CPTEST and CPSBMRKS, fully describe the cell population being measured.

CPCSMRKS.label: Cell State Marker String
CPCSMRKS.description: Identifies the marker(s) or indicator(s) used to define the cell state (i.e., the value in CPCELSTA). \n For example, when Ki67 expression is used to determine that a cell population is in a proliferating state (i.e., CPCELSTA value="PROLIFERATING"), the value "Ki67+" in CPCSMRKS indicates that positive expression of Ki67 was used to define the population as proliferating. Similarly, a value of "Ki67-" in CPCSMRKS would indicate that lack of expression of Ki67 defined the "NON-PROLIFERATING" cell state in CPCELSTA. The CPCSMRKS value is useful for quickly determining which marker(s) were used to classify (i.e., operationally define) a cell population based on a functional/biological state.

CPTSTCND.label: Test Condition
CPTSTCND.description: Identifies any planned condition imposed by the assay system on the specimen at the time the test is performed. --TSTCND is generally used to distinguish between two or more records where the same assay is performed under varying (as opposed to fixed) conditions, usually for the purpose of making a comparison. For example, when the same assay (identified in --TEST) is performed under stimulated and non-stimulated conditions, the --TSTCND variable is used distinguish between the records.

CPCNDAGT.label: Test Condition Agent
CPCNDAGT.description: The textual description of the agent, if applicable, used to impose the condition identified in CPTSTCND. For example, records might be produced for the same assay run under stimulating (CPTSTCND value = "STIMULATED") conditions produced by different stimulating agents (e.g., phorbol myristate acetate, concanavalin A, PHA-P, TNF-alpha, Ionomycin, candida antigen).

CPBDAGNT.label: Binding Agent
CPBDAGNT.description: The textual description of the agent that is binding to the entity in the CPTEST variable. The CPBDAGNT variable is used to indicate that there is a binding relationship between the entities in the CPTEST and CPBDAGNT variables, regardless of direction. \n The binding agent may be, but is not limited to, a test article; a portion of a test article; a substance related to a test article; an endogenous molecule; an allergen; an infectious agent; or a reagent (e.g., primary antibody) that confers the binding specificity for the measurement defined in CPTEST when it is needed to uniquely identify the test.

CPABCLID.label: Antibody Clone Identifier
CPABCLID.description: Identifies the antibody clone (e.g., supplier-provided catalog name) used to confer specificity for the binding agent specified in CPBDAGNT.

CPMRKSTR.label: Marker String
CPMRKSTR.description: The text string identifying the full set of markers/indicators used by the laboratory to operationally define the complete test based on the combination of CPTEST, CPSBMRKS, and CPCELSTA. Because laboratories often use different markers/indicators to identify a cell population, the relationship between a named cell population in CPTEST (as combined with CPSBMRKS and CPCELSTA values) and the set of markers used to identify that population is many-to-one. To ensure nuances important for accurately interpreting the data are accounted for and which arise from the use of different sets of markers, it is necessary to operationally define the test in terms of the complete set of markers/indicators used to perform that test.

CPGATE.label: Gate
CPGATE.description: The sponsor-defined name assigned to a gate. Gates are electronic (i.e., a device setting or software-defined) boundaries set by a user to virtually parse a specimen into discrete populations based on a set of defined characteristics (e.g., presence, absence, or intensity of expression of various markers; physical size; internal complexity or granularity). Gates are used to constrain data collection or analysis to a specific cell population or region of interest within the specimen.

CPGATDEF.label: Gate Definition
CPGATDEF.description: The text string identifying the set of parameters and the order in which they are applied to define the gating strategy. In practice, a series of 2-dimensional sub-gates based on different cell characteristics (i.e., markers/indicators/physical properties) are most often combined until the cell population of interest is sufficiently resolved (i.e., electronically isolated) from other cell populations contained within the specimen. \n For complex analyses, differences in gating strategies can produce subtle differences in results obtained for a test. To ensure nuances important for accurately interpreting the data are accounted for and which arise from the use of different gating strategies, it is often necessary to qualify the test in terms of the gating strategy. For some purposes, however, and at the discretion of the sponsor, only the ultimate or penultimate gate is identified. When specifying the gating strategy in CPGATDEF, each sub-gate should be listed in the order it was applied and separated from the next sub-gate using the pipe/vertical line ("|") character.

CPSPTSTD.label: Sponsor Test Description
CPSPTSTD.description: Sponsor's description of a test. The variable is intended to contain highly structured test description metadata used by a sponsor to unambiguously define (label) a test. Such values generally reside in a sponsor/laboratory test metadata repository. CPSPTSTD is not intended for unstructured (spontaneous) free text. \n An example of appropriate usage is when it is necessary to include identifying information for a target cell population on which a test is conducted when the target population is not part of the test name, e.g., tests for quantitative expression of a particular marker on a specific cell population.

CPCAT.label: Category
CPCAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values across subjects. Examples: "IMMUNOPHENOTYPING", "CELL FUNCTION", "TARGET ENGAGEMENT".

CPTSTPNL.label: Test Panel
CPTSTPNL.description: Sponsor-defined textual description used to group tests run together as part of a test panel. Can be used with --GRPID to ensure that relationships between associated tests are accurately identified.

CPORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
CPORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

CPORRESU.label: Original Units
CPORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for CPORRES. Examples: "10^6/L", "%", "MESF".

CPRESSCL.label: Result Scale
CPRESSCL.description: Classifies the scale of the original result value with respect to whether the result is quantitative, ordinal, nominal, or narrative.

CPRESTYP.label: Result Type
CPRESTYP.description: Classifies the kind of result (i.e., property type) originally reported for the test. Examples: "NUMBER CONCENTRATION", "NUMBER FRACTION", "RATIO".

CPCOLSRT.label: Collected Summary Result Type
CPCOLSRT.description: Used to indicate the type of collected summary result. This includes source summary results collected on a CRF or provided by an external vendor (e.g., central lab). If the summary result is derived using individual source data records, this summary result should be represented in ADaM. If a sponsor has both a collected summary result and a derived summary result, the collected summary result should be represented in SDTM and the derived summary result should be represented in ADaM.

CPORNRLO.label: Reference Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit
CPORNRLO.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.

CPORNRHI.label: Reference Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit
CPORNRHI.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.

CPSTRESC.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
CPSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from CPORRES in a standard format or in standard units. CPSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in CPSTRESN.

CPSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
CPSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from CPSTRESC. CPSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

CPSTRESU.label: Standard Units
CPSTRESU.description: Standardized unit used for CPSTRESC or CPSTRESN.

CPSTNRLO.label: Reference Range Lower Limit-Std Units
CPSTNRLO.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurements for CPSTRESC/CPSTRESN in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.

CPSTNRHI.label: Reference Range Upper Limit-Std Units
CPSTNRHI.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurements in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.

CPNRIND.label: Reference Range Indicator
CPNRIND.description: Indicates where the value falls with respect to reference range defined by CPORNRLO and CPORNRHI, CPSTNRLO and CPSTNRHI, or by CPSTNRC. Examples: "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL", "HIGH", "LOW". Sponsors should specify in the study metadata (Comments column in the Define-XML document) whether CPNRIND refers to the original or standard reference ranges and results. CPNRIND should not be used to indicate clinical significance.

CPSTAT.label: Completion Status
CPSTAT.description: Used to indicate that the test was not performed or that it was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null if a result exists in CPORRES.

CPREASND.label: Reason Not Done
CPREASND.description: Describes why a test was not performed, e.g., "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED", "SPECIMEN LOST". Used in conjunction with CPSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

CPNAM.label: Vendor Name
CPNAM.description: The name or identifier of the laboratory that performed the test.

CPLOINC.label: LOINC Code
CPLOINC.description: Code for the test from the LOINC code system. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.

CPSPEC.label: Specimen Type
CPSPEC.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "BLOOD", "BONE MARROW".

CPSPCCND.label: Specimen Condition
CPSPCCND.description: The physical state or quality of a specimen for an assessment. Example: "CLOTTED".

CPMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
CPMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination. Example: "FLOW CYTOMETRY".

CPANMETH.label: Analysis Method
CPANMETH.description: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result.

CPLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
CPLOBXFL.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

CPBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
CPBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null.

CPDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
CPDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally received or collected are examples of records that might be derived for the submission datasets. If CPDRVFL = "Y", then CPORRES may be null, with CPSTRESC and (if numeric) CPSTRESN having the derived value.

CPCLSIG.label: Clinically Significant, Collected
CPCLSIG.description: Used to indicate whether a collected observation is clinically significant based on judgement.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. Should be an integer.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected.

CPDTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
CPDTC.description: Date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format.

CPDY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
CPDY.description: Study day of specimen collection, measured in integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC value in Demographics.

CPTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
CPTPT.description: Text description of time when a specimen is to be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (i.e., to the value in CPTPTREF). Example: "1 hour post".

CPTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
CPTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of CPTPT to aid in sorting. When CPTPT is represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (i.e., to the value in CPTPTREF), the values in CPTPTNUM should be assigned in ascending order relative to the value in CPTPTREF. For example, records for time points where CPTPT = "5 minutes post", 1 hour post", and "4 hours post" could be represented in CPTPTNUM as "1", "2", and "3", which maintains the order between CPTPT and CPTPTNUM with respect to the fixed time point reference in CPTPTREF.

CPELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
CPELTM.description: Planned elapsed time relative to the planned fixed reference value in CPTPTREF, represented in ISO 8601 duration format. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent 15 minutes prior to the reference time point indicated by CPTPTREF, "T8H" to represent 8 hours after the reference time point represented by CPTPTREF.

CPTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
CPTPTREF.description: Descriptive name of the fixed reference point referred to by CPTPT, CPTPTNUM, and CPELTM. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

CPRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
CPRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by CPTPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

CVSEQ.label: Sequence Number
CVSEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.

CVGRPID.label: Group ID
CVGRPID.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

CVSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
CVSPID.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: a preprinted line identifier on a CRF.

CVLNKID.label: Link ID
CVLNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.

CVLNKGRP.label: Link Group
CVLNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

CVTESTCD.label: Short Name of Cardiovascular Test
CVTESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in CVTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in CVTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" would not be valid). CVTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.

CVTEST.label: Name of Cardiovascular Test
CVTEST.description: Long name For CVTESTCD. The value in CVTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters.

CVCAT.label: Category for Cardiovascular Test
CVCAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.

CVSCAT.label: Subcategory for Cardiovascular Test
CVSCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of CVCAT values.

CVPOS.label: Position of Subject During Observation
CVPOS.description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING".

CVORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
CVORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

CVORRESU.label: Original Units
CVORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. Unit for CVORRES.

CVSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
CVSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived, from CVORRES in a standard format or in standard units. CVSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in CVSTRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in CVORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in CVSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".

CVSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
CVSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from CVSTRESC. CVSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

CVSTRESU.label: Standard Units
CVSTRESU.description: Standardized units used for CVSTRESC and CVSTRESN.

CVSTAT.label: Completion Status
CVSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

CVREASND.label: Reason Not Done
CVREASND.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed (e.g., "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED"). Used in conjunction with CVSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

CVLOC.label: Location Used for the Measurement
CVLOC.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "HEART", "LEFT VENTRICLE".

CVLAT.label: Laterality
CVLAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL", "UNILATERAL".

CVDIR.label: Directionality
CVDIR.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".

CVMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
CVMETHOD.description: Method used to create the result.

CVLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
CVLOBXFL.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

CVBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
CVBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that CVBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

CVDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
CVDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record (i.e., a record that represents the average of other records, such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.

CVEVAL.label: Evaluator
CVEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", " INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".

CVEVALID.label: Evaluator Identifier
CVEVALID.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in CVEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1" or "RADIOLOGIST2".

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.

CVDTC.label: Date/Time of Test
CVDTC.description: Collection date and time of an observation.

CVDY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
CVDY.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

CVTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
CVTPT.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See CVTPTNUM and CVTPTREF.

CVTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
CVTPTNUM.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.

CVELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
CVELTM.description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (CVTPTREF). Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.

CVTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
CVTPTREF.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by CVELTM, CVTPTNUM, and CVTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

CVRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
CVRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by CVTPTREF.

STUDYID.label: Study Identifier
STUDYID.description: Unique identifier for a study within the submission.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

DASEQ.label: Sequence Number
DASEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

DAGRPID.label: Group ID
DAGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

DAREFID.label: Reference ID
DAREFID.description: Optional internal or external identifier such as a code from the product packaging (e.g., bottle label, package label, kit label).

DASPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
DASPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Examples: Line number on the Product Accountability CRF page, a code from the product packaging (e.g., bottle label, package label, kit label).

DALNKID.label: Link ID
DALNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.

DALNKGRP.label: Link Group ID
DALNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

DATESTCD.label: Short Name of Accountability Assessment
DATESTCD.description: Short character value for DATEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters and cannot begin with a number or contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "DISPAMT", "RETAMT".

DATEST.label: Name of Accountability Assessment
DATEST.description: Verbatim name corresponding to the topic variable of the test or examination used to obtain the product accountability assessment. The value in DATEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Dispensed Amount", "Returned Amount".

DACAT.label: Category
DACAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Examples: "STUDY MEDICATION", "RESCUE MEDICATION".

DASCAT.label: Subcategory
DASCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization level for a group of related records.

DAORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
DAORRES.description: Result of the product accountability assessment as originally received or collected.

DASTRESC.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
DASTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all product accountability assessments copied or derived from DAORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. DASTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in DASTRESN.

DASTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
DASTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from DASTRESC. DASTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

DASTRESU.label: Standard Units
DASTRESU.description: Standardized units used for DASTRESC and DASTRESN.

DASTAT.label: Completion Status
DASTAT.description: Used to indicate that a product accountability assessment was not done. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

DAREASND.label: Reason Not Done
DAREASND.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with DASTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit, based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm (see Section 7.2.1, Trial Arms).

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected.

DADTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
DADTC.description: Date and time of the product accountability assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format.

DADY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
DADY.description: Study day of product accountability assessment, measured in integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

DDSEQ.label: Sequence Number
DDSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

DDTESTCD.label: Death Detail Assessment Short Name
DDTESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in DDTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in DDTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). DDTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "PRCDTH", "SECDTH".

DDTEST.label: Death Detail Assessment Name
DDTEST.description: Long name for DDTESTCD. The value in DDTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Primary Cause of Death", "Secondary Cause of Death".

DDORRES.label: Result or Finding as Collected
DDORRES.description: Result of the test defined in DDTEST, as originally received or collected.

DDSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
DDSTRESC.description: Contains the result or finding copied or derived from DDORRES in a standard format.

DDRESCAT.label: Result Category
DDRESCAT.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding. Examples: "TREATMENT RELATED", "NONTREATMENT RELATED", "UNDETERMINED", "ACCIDENTAL".

DDEVAL.label: Evaluator
DDEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation.

DDDTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
DDDTC.description: Date/time of collection of the diagnosis or other death assessment data in ISO 8601 format. This is not necessarily the date of death.

DDDY.label: Study Day of Collection
DDDY.description: Study day of the collection, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

EGSEQ.label: Sequence Number
EGSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

EGGRPID.label: Group ID
EGGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

EGREFID.label: ECG Reference ID
EGREFID.description: Internal or external ECG identifier. Example: "334PT89".

EGSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
EGSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on the ECG page.

EGBEATNO.label: ECG Beat Number
EGBEATNO.description: A sequence number that identifies the beat within an ECG.

EGTESTCD.label: ECG Test or Examination Short Name
EGTESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in EGTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in EGTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). EGTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "PRAG", "QRSAG". \n Test codes are in 2 separate codelists, 1 for tests based on regular 10-second ECGs (EGTESTCD) and one 1 tests based on Holter monitoring (HETESTCD).

EGTEST.label: ECG Test or Examination Name
EGTEST.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in EGTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "PR Interval, Aggregate", "QRS Duration, Aggregate". \n Test names are in 2 separate codelists, 1 for tests based on regular 10-second ECGs (EGTEST) and 1 for tests based on Holter monitoring (HETEST).

EGCAT.label: Category for ECG
EGCAT.description: Used to categorize ECG observations across subjects. Examples: "MEASUREMENT", "FINDING", "INTERVAL".

EGSCAT.label: Subcategory for ECG
EGSCAT.description: A further categorization of the ECG.

EGPOS.label: ECG Position of Subject
EGPOS.description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING".

EGORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
EGORRES.description: Result of the ECG measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples of expected values are "62" or "0.151" when the result is an interval or measurement, or "ATRIAL FIBRILLATION" or "QT PROLONGATION" when the result is a finding.

EGORRESU.label: Original Units
EGORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for EGORRES. Examples: "sec", "msec".

EGSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
EGSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from EGORRES, in a standard format or standard units. EGSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in EGSTRESN. For example, if a test has results of 62 beats/min, then EGORRES = "62", EGORRESU = "beats/min", EGSTRESC = "62", EGSTRESN = 62, and EGSTRESU = "beats/min" . For other examples, see Original and Standardized Results. Additional examples of result data: "SINUS BRADYCARDIA", "ATRIAL FLUTTER", "ATRIAL FIBRILLATION". \n Test results are in 3 separate codelists: EGSTRESC for abnormal test results based on regular 10-second ECGs; HESTRESC for abnormal test results based on Holter monitoring, and NORMABNM for generic test results and/or responses to EGTEST = "Interpretation".

EGSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
EGSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from EGSTRESC. EGSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

EGSTRESU.label: Standard Units
EGSTRESU.description: Standardized units used for EGSTRESC and EGSTRESN.

EGSTAT.label: Completion Status
EGSTAT.description: Used to indicate an ECG was not done, or an ECG measurement was not taken. Should be null if a result exists in EGORRES.

EGREASND.label: Reason ECG Not Done
EGREASND.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with EGSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

EGXFN.label: ECG External File Path
EGXFN.description: File name and path for the external ECG waveform file.

EGNAM.label: Vendor Name
EGNAM.description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor providing the test results.

EGMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
EGMETHOD.description: Method of the ECG test. Example: "12-LEAD STANDARD".

EGLEAD.label: Lead Location Used for Measurement
EGLEAD.description: The lead used for the measurement. Examples: "LEAD 1", "LEAD 2", "LEAD rV2", "LEAD V1".

EGLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
EGLOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

EGBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
EGBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that EGBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

EGDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
EGDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or that do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally collected or received are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If EGDRVFL="Y", then EGORRES could be null, with EGSTRESC and EGSTRESN (if the result is numeric) having the derived value.

EGEVAL.label: Evaluator
EGEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain collected or derived data. Examples: "INVESTIGATOR", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "VENDOR".

EGEVALID.label: Evaluator Identifier
EGEVALID.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in EGEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST 1" or "RADIOLOGIST 2".

EGCLSIG.label: Clinically Significant, Collected
EGCLSIG.description: Used to indicate whether a collected observation is clinically significant based on judgment.

EGREPNUM.label: Repetition Number
EGREPNUM.description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Examples: multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.

EGDY.label: Study Day of ECG
EGDY.description: Study day of the ECG, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

EGTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
EGTPT.description: Text description of time when measurement should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See EGTPTNUM and EGTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post".

EGTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
EGTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of EGTPT to aid in sorting.

EGELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
EGELTM.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a fixed time point reference (EGTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF.

EGTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
EGTPTREF.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by EGELTM, EGTPTNUM, and EGTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

EGRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
EGRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by EGTPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

FTSEQ.label: Sequence Number
FTSEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number.

FTGRPID.label: Group ID
FTGRPID.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

FTSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
FTSPID.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on the Test page.

FTTESTCD.label: Short Name of Test
FTTESTCD.description: Short character value for FTTEST, which can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The value cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). FTTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. \n Controlled terminology for FTTESTCD is published in separate codelists for each instrument. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/terminology/controlled-terminology for values for FTTESTCD. Examples: "W250101", "W25F0102".

FTTEST.label: Name of Test
FTTEST.description: Verbatim name of the question used to obtain the finding. The value in FTTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. \n Controlled terminology for FTTEST is published in separate codelists for each instrument. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/terminology/controlled-terminology for values for FTTEST. Examples: "W2501-25 Foot Walk Time", "W25F-More Than Two Attempts".

FTCAT.label: Category
FTCAT.description: Used to specify the functional test in which the functional test question identified by FTTEST and FTTESTCD was included.

FTSCAT.label: Subcategory
FTSCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of FTCAT values.

FTPOS.label: Position of Subject During Observation
FTPOS.description: Position of the subject during the test. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING".

FTORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
FTORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

FTORRESU.label: Original Units
FTORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. Unit for FTORRES.

FTSTRESC.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
FTSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from FTORRES in a standard format or in standard units. FTSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in FTSTRESN.

FTSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
FTSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from FTSTRESC. FTSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

FTSTRESU.label: Standard Units
FTSTRESU.description: Standardized units used for FTSTRESC and FTSTRESN.

FTSTAT.label: Completion Status
FTSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

FTREASND.label: Reason Not Done
FTREASND.description: Describes why a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Used in conjunction with FTSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

FTXFN.label: External File Path
FTXFN.description: File path to an external file.

FTNAM.label: Vendor Name
FTNAM.description: Name or identifier of the vendor or laboratory that provided the test results.

FTMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
FTMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination.

FTLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
FTLOBXFL.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

FTBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
FTBLFL.description: A baseline defined by the sponsor (could be derived in the same manner as FTLOBXFL or ABLFL, but is not required to be). The value should be "Y" or null. Note that FTBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

FTDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
FTDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.

FTREPNUM.label: Repetition Number
FTREPNUM.description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Examples: multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. Should be an integer.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the observation date/time of the functional tests finding.

FTDTC.label: Date/Time of Test
FTDTC.description: Collection date and time of functional test.

FTDY.label: Study Day of Test
FTDY.description: Actual study day of test expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

FTTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
FTTPT.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See FTTPTNUM and FTTPTREF.

FTTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
FTTPTNUM.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.

FTELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
FTELTM.description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (FTTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.

FTTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
FTTPTREF.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by FTELTM, FTTPTNUM, and FTTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

FTRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
FTRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by FTTPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

NHOID.label: Non-Host Organism Identifier
NHOID.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism which should only be used when the organism is the subject of the TEST. This variable should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the non-host organism as reported by a lab (e.g., "A/California/7/2009 (H1N1)"). It is not to be used as a qualifier of the result in the record on which it appears.

GFSEQ.label: Sequence Number
GFSEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.

GFGRPID.label: Group ID
GFGRPID.description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

GFREFID.label: Reference ID
GFREFID.description: A unique identifier for the assayed genetic specimen.

GFLNKID.label: Link ID
GFLNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.

GFLNKGRP.label: Link Group ID
GFLNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

GFTESTCD.label: Short Name of Genomic Measurement
GFTESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in GFTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in GFTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). GFTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.

GFTEST.label: Name of Genomic Measurement
GFTEST.description: Long name for GFTESTCD. The value in GFTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters.

GFTSTDTL.label: Measurement, Test, or Examination Detail
GFTSTDTL.description: Description of a reportable qualifying the assessment in GFTESTCD and GFTEST.

GFCAT.label: Category for Genomic Finding
GFCAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.

GFSCAT.label: Subcategory for Genomic Finding
GFSCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of GFCAT values.

GFORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
GFORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

GFORREF.label: Reference Result in Original Units
GFORREF.description: Reference value for the result or finding as originally received or collected. GFORREF uses the same units as GFORRES, if applicable.

GFSTRESC.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
GFSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from GFORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. GFSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in GFSTRESN.

GFSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
GFSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from GFSTRESC. GFSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

GFSTRESU.label: Standard Units
GFSTRESU.description: Standardized units used for GFSTRESC, GFSTRESN, GFSTREFC, and GFSTREFN.

GFSTREFC.label: Reference Result in Standard Format
GFSTREFC.description: Reference value for the result or finding copied or derived from GFORREF in a standard format.

GFSTREFN.label: Numeric Reference Result in Std Units
GFSTREFN.description: Reference value for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format or in standard units. GFSTREFN uses the same units as GFSTRESN, if applicable.

GFRESCAT.label: Result Category
GFRESCAT.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding.

GFINHERT.label: Inheritability
GFINHERT.description: Identifies whether the variation can be passed to the next generation.

GFGENREF.label: Genome Reference
GFGENREF.description: An identifier for the genome reference used to generate the reported result. For example, Genome Reference Consortium Human Build 38 patch release 13 may be represented as "GRCh38.p13".

GFCHROM.label: Chromosome Identifier
GFCHROM.description: The designation (name or number) of the chromosome or contig on which the variant or other feature appears (e.g., "17"; "X").

GFSYM.label: Genomic Symbol
GFSYM.description: A published symbol for the portion of the genome serving as a locus for the experiment/test.

GFSYMTYP.label: Genomic Symbol Type
GFSYMTYP.description: A description of the type of genomic entity that is represented by the published symbol in GFSYM.

GFGENLOC.label: Genetic Location
GFGENLOC.description: Specifies the location within a sequence for the observed value in GFORRES.

GFGENSR.label: Genetic Sub-Region
GFGENSR.description: The portion of the locus in which the variation was found. Examples: "Exon 15", "Kinase domain".

GFSEQID.label: Sequence Identifier \n
GFSEQID.description: A unique identifier for the sequence used as the reference to identify the genetic variation in the result. Examples: "NM_001234", "ENSG00000182533", "ENST00000343849.2".

GFPVRID.label: Published Variant Identifier
GFPVRID.description: A unique identifier for the variation that has been publicly characterized in an external database. Examples: "rs2231142", "COSM41596".

GFCOPYID.label: Copy Identifier
GFCOPYID.description: An arbitrary identifier used to differentiate between copies of a genetic target of interest present on homologous chromosomes.

GFSTAT.label: Completion Status
GFSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

GFREASND.label: Reason Test Not Done
GFREASND.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with GFSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

GFXFN.label: External File Path
GFXFN.description: The filename and/or path to external data not stored in the same format and possibly not the same location as the other data for a study.

GFNAM.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
GFNAM.description: Name or identifier of the vendor that provided the test result. When more than 1 vendor is involved in the generation of the result, additional vendors should be represented as supplemental qualifiers.

GFSPEC.label: Specimen Material Type
GFSPEC.description: Identifies the type of genetic material used for the measurement.

GFMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
GFMETHOD.description: The test method by which the examination is performed by the wet lab in order to yield the result reported in the dataset.

GFRUNID.label: Run ID
GFRUNID.description: A unique identifier for a particular run of a test performed by the wet lab on a particular batch of samples. This identifier can be used to distinguish between records for the same test performed at different times.

GFANMETH.label: Analysis Method
GFANMETH.description: The method of secondary processing performed by the dry lab to yield the result reported in the dataset.

GFBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
GFBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null.

GFDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
GFDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.

GFLLOQ.label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
GFLLOQ.description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for GFSTRESU.

GFREPNUM.label: Repetition Number
GFREPNUM.description: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test performed by the wet lab.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

GFDTC.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
GFDTC.description: Date and time of specimen collection.

GFDY.label: Study Day of Specimen Collection
GFDY.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

GFTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
GFTPT.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See GFTPTNUM and GFTPTREF.

GFTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
GFTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of GFTPT used in sorting.

GFELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
GFELTM.description: Elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (GFTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.

GFTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
GFTPTREF.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by GFELTM, GFTPTNUM, and GFTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

GFRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
GFRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by GFTPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

IESEQ.label: Sequence Number
IESEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

IESPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
IESPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Inclusion or exclusion criteria number from CRF.

IETESTCD.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion Short Name
IETESTCD.description: Short name of the criterion described in IETEST. The value in IETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). IETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "IN01", "EX01".

IETEST.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion
IETEST.description: Verbatim description of the inclusion or exclusion criterion that was the exception for the subject within the study. IETEST cannot be longer than 200 characters.

IECAT.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Category
IECAT.description: Used to define a category of related records across subjects.

IESCAT.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Subcategory
IESCAT.description: A further categorization of the exception criterion. Can be used to distinguish criteria for a sub-study or for to categorize as a major or minor exceptions. Examples: "MAJOR", "MINOR".

IEORRES.label: I/E Criterion Original Result
IEORRES.description: Original response to inclusion/exclusion criterion question, i.e., whether the inclusion or exclusion criterion was met.

IESTRESC.label: I/E Criterion Result in Std Format
IESTRESC.description: Response to inclusion/exclusion criterion result, in standard format.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the observation date/time of the inclusion/exclusion finding.

IEDTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
IEDTC.description: Collection date and time of the inclusion/exclusion criterion represented in ISO 8601 character format.

IEDY.label: Study Day of Collection
IEDY.description: Study day of collection of the inclusion/exclusion exceptions, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

NHOID.label: Non-host Organism ID
NHOID.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism which should only be used when the organism is the subject of the TEST. This variable should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the non-host organism as reported by a lab (e.g., "A/California/7/2009 (H1N1)"). It is not to be used as a qualifier of the result in the record on which it appears.

ISSEQ.label: Sequence Number
ISSEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.

ISGRPID.label: Group ID
ISGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

ISREFID.label: Reference ID
ISREFID.description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: "458975-01".

ISTESTCD.label: Immunogenicity Test/Exam Short Name
ISTESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in ISTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in ISTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). ISTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.

ISTEST.label: Immunogenicity Test or Examination Name
ISTEST.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in ISTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Immunoglobulin E".

ISTSTCND.label: Test Condition
ISTSTCND.description: Identifies any planned condition imposed by the assay system on the specimen at the time the test is performed.

ISCNDAGT.label: Test Condition Agent
ISCNDAGT.description: The textual description of the agent used to impose a test condition. Examples are different stimulating agents used in immunoassays such as those in the Interferon Gamma Response assay (e.g., Mycobacterium tuberculosis ESAT-6, CFP-10, TB 7.7, Mitogen).

ISBDAGNT.label: Binding Agent
ISBDAGNT.description: Text description of the agent that is binding to the entity in the ISTEST variable. ISBDAGNT is used to indicate that there is a binding relationship between the entities in the ISTEST and ISBDAGNT variables, regardless of direction. \n ISBDAGNT is not a method qualifier. It should only be used when the actual interest of the measurement is the binding interaction between the 2 entities in ISTEST and ISBDAGNT. In other words, the combination of ISTEST and ISBDAGNT should describe the entity or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables. \n The binding agent may be (but is not limited to) a test article, a portion of the test article, a related compound, an endogenous molecule, an allergen, or an infectious agent.

ISTSTOPO.label: Test Operational Objective
ISTSTOPO.description: Text description of the high-level purpose of the test at the operational level. If populated, valid values are "SCREEN", "CONFIRM", and "QUANTIFY".

ISMSCBCE.label: Molecule Secreted by Cells
ISMSCBCE.description: Text description of the entity secreted by the cells represented in ISTEST. The combination of ISTEST and ISMSCBCE should describe the entity or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables.

ISTSTDTL.label: Test Detail
ISTSTDTL.description: Further description of ISTESTCD and ISTEST.

ISCAT.label: Category for Immunogenicity Test
ISCAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values across subjects. Example: "SEROLOGY".

ISORRES.label: Results or Findings in Original Units
ISORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

ISORRESU.label: Original Units
ISORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for ISORRES. Examples: "Index Value", "gpELISA", "unit/mL".

ISORNRLO.label: Reference Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit
ISORNRLO.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.

ISORNRHI.label: Reference Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit
ISORNRHI.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.

ISSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
ISSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from ISORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. ISSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in ISSTRESN.

ISSTRESN.label: Numeric Results/Findings in Std. Units
ISSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from ISSTRESC. ISSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

ISSTRESU.label: Standard Units
ISSTRESU.description: Standardized units used for ISSTRESC and ISSTRESN. Examples: "Index Value", "gpELISA", "unit/mL".

ISSTNRLO.label: Reference Range Lower Limit-Std Units
ISSTNRLO.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurements for ISSTRESC/ISSTRESN in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.

ISSTNRHI.label: Reference Range Upper Limit-Std Units
ISSTNRHI.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurements in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.

ISSTNRC.label: Reference Range for Char Rslt-Std Units
ISSTNRC.description: For normal range values that are character in ordinal scale or if categorical ranges were supplied. Examples: "-1 to +1", "NEGATIVE TO TRACE".

ISNRIND.label: Reference Range Indicator
ISNRIND.description: Indicates where the value falls with respect to reference range defined by ISORNRLO and ISORNRHI, ISSTNRLO and ISSTNRHI, or by ISSTNRC. Examples: "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL", "HIGH", "LOW". \n Sponsors should specify in the study metadata (Comments column in the Define-XML document) whether ISNRIND refers to the original or standard reference ranges and results. \n Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.

ISSTAT.label: Completion Status
ISSTAT.description: Used to indicate a test was not done. Should be null if a result exists in ISORRES.

ISREASND.label: Reason Not Done
ISREASND.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Used in conjunction with ISSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

ISNAM.label: Vendor Name
ISNAM.description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor who provided the test results.

ISSPEC.label: Specimen Type
ISSPEC.description: Defines the types of specimen used for a measurement. Example: "SERUM".

ISSPCCND.label: Specimen Condition
ISSPCCND.description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen. Examples: "HEMOLYZED", "ICTERIC", "LIPEMIC".

ISSPCUFL.label: Specimen Usability for the Test
ISSPCUFL.description: Describes the usability of the specimen for the test. The value will be "N" if the specimen is not usable, and null if the specimen is usable.

ISMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
ISMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "ELISA", "ELISPOT".

ISLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
ISLOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

ISBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
ISBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that ISBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

ISDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
ISDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Examples of records that might be derived for the submission datasets include those that represent the average of other records, do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally received or collected.
