If ISDRVFL="Y", then ISORRES may be null, with ISSTRESC and (if numeric) ISSTRESN having the derived value.

ISLLOQ.label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
ISLLOQ.description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for ISSTRESU.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected.

ISDTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
ISDTC.description: Collection date and time of an observation.

ISDY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
ISDY.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

ISENDY.label: Study Day of End of Specimen Collection
ISENDY.description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

ISTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
ISTPT.description: Text description of time when specimen should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See ISTPTNUM and ISTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post".

ISTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
ISTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of ISTPT to aid in sorting.

ISELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
ISELTM.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (ISTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable. Represented as ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by ISTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by ISTPTREF.

ISTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
ISTPTREF.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by ISELTM, ISTPTNUM, and ISTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

ISRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
ISRFTDTC.description: Date/time of the reference time point, ISTPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

LBSEQ.label: Sequence Number
LBSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

LBGRPID.label: Group ID
LBGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

LBREFID.label: Specimen ID
LBREFID.description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: specimen ID.

LBSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
LBSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on the Lab page.

LBTESTCD.label: Lab Test or Examination Short Name
LBTESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in LBTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in LBTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). LBTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "ALT", "LDH".

LBTEST.label: Lab Test or Examination Name
LBTEST.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Note: Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test. The value in LBTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Alanine Aminotransferase", "Lactate Dehydrogenase".

LBTSTCND.label: Test Condition
LBTSTCND.description: Identifies any planned condition imposed by the assay system on the specimen at the time the test is performed.

LBBDAGNT.label: Binding Agent
LBBDAGNT.description: The textual description of the agent that is binding to the entity in the LBTEST variable. The LBBDAGNT variable is used to indicate that there is a binding relationship between the entities in the LBTEST and LBBDAGNT variables, regardless of direction. \n LBBDAGNT is not a method qualifier. It should only be used when the actual interest of the measurement is the binding interaction between the 2 entities in LBTEST and LBBDAGNT. In other words, the combination of LBTEST and LBBDAGNT should describe the thing, the entity, or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables. \n The binding agent may be (but is not limited to) a test article, a portion of the test article, a related compound, or an endogenous molecule.

LBTSTOPO.label: Test Operational Objective
LBTSTOPO.description: Text description of the high-level purpose of the test at the operational level.

LBCAT.label: Category for Lab Test
LBCAT.description: Used to define a category of related records across subjects. Examples: "HEMATOLOGY", "URINALYSIS", "CHEMISTRY".

LBSCAT.label: Subcategory for Lab Test
LBSCAT.description: A further categorization of a test category. Examples: "DIFFERENTIAL", "COAGULATION", "LIVER FUNCTION", "ELECTROLYTES".

LBORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
LBORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

LBORRESU.label: Original Units
LBORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for LBORRES. Example: "g/L".

LBRESSCL.label: Result Scale
LBRESSCL.description: Classifies the scale of the original result value; for example, whether the result is ordinal, nominal, quantitative, or narrative.

LBRESTYP.label: Result Type
LBRESTYP.description: Classifies the kind of result (i.e., property type) originally reported for the test. Examples include substance concentration, proportion, mass rate, and arbitrary concentration.

LBCOLSRT.label: Collected Summary Result Type
LBCOLSRT.description: Used to indicate the type of collected summary result. This includes source summary results collected on a CRF or provided by an external vendor (e.g., central lab). If the summary result is derived by the sponsor using individual source data records from SDTM, the derived summary result is represented in ADaM. If the summary result is produced and reported by the lab, the collected summary result is represented in SDTM.

LBORNRLO.label: Reference Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit
LBORNRLO.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.

LBORNRHI.label: Reference Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit
LBORNRHI.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.

LBLLOD.label: Lower Limit of Detection
LBLLOD.description: The lowest threshold (as originally received or collected) for reliably detecting the presence or absence of substance measured by a specific test. The value for the field will be as described in documentation from the instrument or lab vendor.

LBSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
LBSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from LBORRES in a standard format or standard units. LBSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in LBSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in LBORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in LBSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". For other examples, see Original and Standardized Results.

LBSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
LBSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from LBSTRESC. LBSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

LBSTRESU.label: Standard Units
LBSTRESU.description: Standardized unit used for LBSTRESC or LBSTRESN.

LBSTNRLO.label: Reference Range Lower Limit-Std Units
LBSTNRLO.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurements for LBSTRESC/LBSTRESN in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.

LBSTNRHI.label: Reference Range Upper Limit-Std Units
LBSTNRHI.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurements in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.

LBSTNRC.label: Reference Range for Char Rslt-Std Units
LBSTNRC.description: For normal range values that are character in ordinal scale or if categorical ranges were supplied. Examples: "-1 to +1", "NEGATIVE TO TRACE".

LBNRIND.label: Reference Range Indicator
LBNRIND.description: Indicates where the value falls with respect to reference range defined by LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI, LBSTNRLO and LBSTNRHI, or by LBSTNRC. Examples: "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL", "HIGH", "LOW". Sponsors should specify in the study metadata (Comments column in the Define-XML document) whether LBNRIND refers to the original or standard reference ranges and results. LBNRIND is not used to indicate clinical significance.

LBSTAT.label: Completion Status
LBSTAT.description: Used to indicate exam not done. Should be null if a result exists in LBORRES.

LBREASND.label: Reason Test Not Done
LBREASND.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED", or "SPECIMEN LOST". Used in conjunction with LBSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

LBNAM.label: Vendor Name
LBNAM.description: The name or identifier of the laboratory that performed the test.

LBLOINC.label: LOINC Code
LBLOINC.description: Code for the lab test from the LOINC code system. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.

LBSPEC.label: Specimen Type
LBSPEC.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "SERUM", "PLASMA", "URINE".

LBSPCCND.label: Specimen Condition
LBSPCCND.description: The physical state or quality of a sample for an assessment. Examples: "HEMOLYZED", "ICTERIC", "LIPEMIC".

LBSPCUFL.label: Specimen Usability for the Test
LBSPCUFL.description: Describes the usability of the specimen for the test. The value will be "N" if the specimen is not usable, and null if the specimen is usable.

LBMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
LBMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "EIA" (enzyme immunoassay), "ELECTROPHORESIS", "DIPSTICK".

LBANMETH.label: Analysis Method
LBANMETH.description: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result (e.g., a calculation used to measure eGFR).

LBTMTHSN.label: Test Method Sensitivity
LBTMTHSN.description: The sensitivity of the test methodology with respect to observation, detection, or quantification.

LBLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
LBLOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

LBBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
LBBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that LBBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

LBFAST.label: Fasting Status
LBFAST.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Examples: "Y", "N".

LBDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
LBDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally received or collected are examples of records that might be derived for the submission datasets. If LBDRVFL="Y", then LBORRES may be null, with LBSTRESC and (if numeric) LBSTRESN having the derived value.

LBTOX.label: Toxicity
LBTOX.description: Description of toxicity quantified by LBTOXGR. The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.

LBTOXGR.label: Standard Toxicity Grade
LBTOXGR.description: Records toxicity grade value using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., the NCI CTCAE). If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., "2" not "Grade 2"). The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.

LBCLSIG.label: Clinically Significant, Collected
LBCLSIG.description: Used to indicate whether a collected observation is clinically significant based on judgment.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected.

LBDTC.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
LBDTC.description: Date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format.

LBENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Specimen Collection
LBENDTC.description: End date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format.

LBDY.label: Study Day of Specimen Collection
LBDY.description: Study day of specimen collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.

LBENDY.label: Study Day of End of Observation
LBENDY.description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

LBTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
LBTPT.description: Text description of time when specimen should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See LBTPTNUM and LBTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post".

LBTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
LBTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of LBTPT to aid in sorting.

LBELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
LBELTM.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (LBTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable. Represented as ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by LBTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by LBTPTREF.

LBTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
LBTPTREF.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by LBELTM, LBTPTNUM, and LBTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

LBRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
LBRFTDTC.description: Date/time of the reference time point, LBTPTREF.

LBPTFL.label: Point in Time Flag
LBPTFL.description: An indication that the specimen was collected at a single point in time. The value is "Y" or null. The intent of this variable in the LB domain is to aid mapping to LOINC codes in the dataset, when LOINC part "Time Aspect" = "Pt".

LBPDUR.label: Planned Duration
LBPDUR.description: Planned duration of specimen collection. If LBPTFL is "Y" then LBPDUR is null.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

FOCID.label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest
FOCID.description: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed. The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning.

MBSEQ.label: Sequence Number
MBSEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number.

MBGRPID.label: Group ID
MBGRPID.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

MBREFID.label: Reference ID
MBREFID.description: Internal or external specimen identifier (e.g., sample ID for a subject sample from which a microbial culture was generated).

MBSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
MBSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.

MBLNKID.label: Link ID
MBLNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. For example, it may be used to link genetic findings (in the PF domain) about a microbe to the original culture of that microbe (in MB), or to susceptibility records (in MS) if needed.

MBLNKGRP.label: Link Group ID
MBLNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

MBTESTCD.label: Microbiology Test or Finding Short Name
MBTESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or finding described in MBTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in MBTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). MBTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "MCORGIDN" for Microbial Organism Identification "GMNCOC" for Gram Negative Cocci.

MBTEST.label: Microbiology Test or Finding Name
MBTEST.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in MBTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Microbial Organism Identification", "Gram Negative Cocci", "HIV-1 RNA".

MBTSTDTL.label: Measurement, Test or Examination Detail
MBTSTDTL.description: Further description of MBTESTCD and MBTEST. Example: "VIRAL LOAD" when MBTESTCD represents viral genetic material, such as "HCRNA", "QUANTIFICATION" when MBTESTCD represents any organism being quantified.

MBCAT.label: Category
MBCAT.description: Used to define a category of related records.

MBSCAT.label: Subcategory
MBSCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of MBCAT values.

MBORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
MBORRES.description: Result of the microbiology measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples for "GRAM STAIN" findings: "+3 MODERATE", "+2 FEW", "<10". Examples for "CULTURE PLATE" findings: "KLEBSIELLA PNEUMONIAE", "STREPTOCOCCUS PNEUMONIAE".

MBSTRESC.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
MBSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from MBORRES, in a standard format or standard units. MBSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MBSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "+3 MODERATE", "MOD", and "MODERATE" in MBORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in MBSTRESC as "MODERATE".

MBSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
MBSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MBSTRESC. MBSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

MBSTRESU.label: Standard Units
MBSTRESU.description: Standardized units used for MBSTRESC and MBSTRESN.

MBRESCAT.label: Result Category
MBRESCAT.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding in a standard format.

MBSTAT.label: Completion Status
MBSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or that a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

MBREASND.label: Reason Not Done
MBREASND.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with MBSTAT when value is NOT DONE. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED".

MBNAM.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
MBNAM.description: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

MBLOINC.label: LOINC Code
MBLOINC.description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) code for the topic variable (e.g., lab test).

MBSPEC.label: Specimen Material Type
MBSPEC.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "SPUTUM", "BLOOD", "PUS".

MBSPCCND.label: Specimen Condition
MBSPCCND.description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen. Example: "CONTAMINATED".

MBLOC.label: Specimen Collection Location
MBLOC.description: Anatomical location relevant to the collection of the measurement.

MBLAT.label: Laterality
MBLAT.description: Qualifier for specimen collection location further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".

MBDIR.label: Directionality
MBDIR.description: Qualifier for specimen collection location further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".

MBMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
MBMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "GRAM STAIN", "MICROBIAL CULTURE, LIQUID", "QUANTITATIVE REVERSE TRANSCRIPTASE POLYMERASE CHAIN REACTION".

MBLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
MBLOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

MBBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
MBBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that MBBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

MBFAST.label: Fasting Status
MBFAST.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Valid values include "Y", "N", "U", or null if not relevant.

MBDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
MBDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element which the specimen collection occurred.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the specimen was collected.

MBDY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
MBDY.description: Study day of the specimen collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.

MBTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
MBTPT.description: Text description of time when specimen should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See MBTPTNUM and MBTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post".

MBTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
MBTPTNUM.description: Numeric version of MBTPT used in sorting.

MBELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
MBELTM.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (MBTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by MBTPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by MBTPTREF.

MBTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
MBTPTREF.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by MBELTM, MBTPTNUM, and MBTPT. Example: "PREVIOUS DOSE".

MBRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
MBRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point, MBTPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

MISEQ.label: Sequence Number
MISEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

MIGRPID.label: Group ID
MIGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. This is not the treatment group number.

MIREFID.label: Reference ID
MIREFID.description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: specimen barcode number.

MISPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
MISPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: line number from the MI Findings page.

MITESTCD.label: Microscopic Examination Short Name
MITESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in MITEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in MITESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). MITESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "HER2", "BRCA1", "TTF1".

MITEST.label: Microscopic Examination Name
MITEST.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in MITEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2", "Breast Cancer Susceptibility Gene 1", "Thyroid Transcription Factor 1".

MITSTDTL.label: Microscopic Examination Detail
MITSTDTL.description: Further description of the test performed in producing the MI result. This would be used to represent specific attributes, such as intensity score or percentage of cells displaying presence of the biomarker or compound.

MICAT.label: Category for Microscopic Finding
MICAT.description: Used to define a category of related records.

MISCAT.label: Subcategory for Microscopic Finding
MISCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of MICAT.

MIORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
MIORRES.description: Result of the histopathology measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

MISTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
MISTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from MIORRES in a standard format or standard units. MISTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MISTRESN.

MISTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
MISTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MISTRESC. MISTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

MISTRESU.label: Standard Units
MISTRESU.description: Standardized unit used for MISTRESC and MISTRESN.

MIRESCAT.label: Result Category
MIRESCAT.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding. Examples: "MALIGNANT" or "BENIGN" for tumor findings.

MISTAT.label: Completion Status
MISTAT.description: Used to indicate examination not done or result is missing. Should be null if a result exists in MIORRES or have a value of "NOT DONE" when MIORRES = "NULL".

MIREASND.label: Reason Not Done
MIREASND.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with MISTAT when value is NOT DONE. Examples: "SAMPLE AUTOLYZED", "SPECIMEN LOST".

MINAM.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
MINAM.description: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

MISPEC.label: Specimen Material Type
MISPEC.description: Subject of the observation. Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "TISSUE", "BLOOD", "BONE MARROW".

MISPCCND.label: Specimen Condition
MISPCCND.description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen. Example: "AUTOLYZED".

MILOC.label: Specimen Collection Location
MILOC.description: Location relevant to the collection of the specimen. Examples: "LUNG", "KNEE JOINT", "ARM", "THIGH".

MILAT.label: Specimen Laterality within Subject
MILAT.description: Qualifier for laterality of the location of the specimen in MILOC. Examples: "LEFT", "RIGHT", "BILATERAL".

MIDIR.label: Specimen Directionality within Subject
MIDIR.description: Qualifier for directionality of the location of the specimen in MILOC. Examples: "DORSAL", "PROXIMAL".

MIMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
MIMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination. This could include the technique or type of staining used for the slides. Examples: "IHC", "Crystal violet", "Safranin", "Trypan blue", or "Propidium iodide".

MILOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
MILOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

MIBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
MIBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null. Note that MIBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

MIEVAL.label: Evaluator
MIEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Example: "PATHOLOGIST", "PEER REVIEW", "SPONSOR PATHOLOGIST".

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the specimen was collected.

MIDTC.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
MIDTC.description: Date/time of specimen collection, in ISO 8601 format.

MIDY.label: Study Day of Specimen Collection
MIDY.description: Study day of specimen collection, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

MKSEQ.label: Sequence Number
MKSEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject (or within a parameter, in the case of the Trial Summary domain). May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.

MKGRPID.label: Group ID
MKGRPID.description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

MKREFID.label: Reference ID
MKREFID.description: Optional internal or external identifier such as lab specimen ID or a medical image.

MKSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
MKSPID.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: Preprinted line identifier on a Concomitant Medications page.

MKLNKID.label: Link ID
MKLNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.

MKLNKGRP.label: Link Group ID
MKLNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

MKTESTCD.label: Short Name of Musculoskeletal Test
MKTESTCD.description: Short character value for MKTEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The value in MKTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). MKTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "TNDRIND", "SWLLIND", "SGJSNSCR".

MKTEST.label: Name of Musculoskeletal Test
MKTEST.description: Long name For MKTESTCD. Examples: "Tenderness Indicator", "Swollen Indicator", "Sharp/Genant JSN Score".

MKCAT.label: Category for Musculoskeletal Test
MKCAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Examples: "SWOLLEN/TENDER JOINT ASSESSMENT".

MKSCAT.label: Subcategory for Musculoskeletal Test
MKSCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of MKCAT values.

MKPOS.label: Position of Subject
MKPOS.description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING".

MKORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
MKORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

MKSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
MKSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from MKORRES in a standard format or in standard units. MKSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MKSTRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in MKORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in MKSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".

MKSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
MKSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MKSTRESC. MKSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

MKSTRESU.label: Standard Units
MKSTRESU.description: Standardized units used for MKSTRESC and MKSTRESN.

MKSTAT.label: Completion Status
MKSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or that a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null if a result exists in MKORRES.

MKREASND.label: Reason Not Done
MKREASND.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with MKSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

MKLOC.label: Location Used for the Measurement
MKLOC.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "INTERPHALANGEAL JOINT 1", "SHOULDER JOINT".

MKLAT.label: Laterality
MKLAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".

MKDIR.label: Directionality
MKDIR.description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".

MKMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
MKMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "X-RAY", "MRI", "CT SCAN".

MKLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
MKLOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

MKBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
MKBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that MKBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

MKDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
MKDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.

MKEVAL.label: Evaluator
MKEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".

MKEVALID.label: Evaluator Identifier
MKEVALID.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in MKEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1" or "RADIOLOGIST2".

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.

MKDTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
MKDTC.description: Collection date and time of an observation.

MKDY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
MKDY.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

MKTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
MKTPT.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See MKTPTNUM and MKTPTREF.

MKTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
MKTPTNUM.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.

MKELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
MKELTM.description: Planned Elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (MKTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.

MKTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
MKTPTREF.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by MKELTM, MKTPTNUM, and MKTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

MKRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
MKRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by MKTPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

NHOID.label: Non-host Organism ID
NHOID.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism which should only be used when the organism is the subject of the TEST. This variable should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the non-host organism as reported by a lab (e.g., "A/California/7/2009 (H1N1)"). It is not to be used as a qualifier of the result in the record on which it appears.

MSSEQ.label: Sequence Number
MSSEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject (or within a parameter, in the case of the Trial Summary domain). May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.

MSGRPID.label: Group ID
MSGRPID.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. In SDTMIG v3.2 this was an Expected variable. In this version, the core designation has been changed to Permissible.

MSREFID.label: Reference ID
MSREFID.description: Optional internal or external identifier (e.g., an identifier for the culture/isolate being tested for susceptibility).

MSSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
MSSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.

MSLNKID.label: Link ID
MSLNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. For example, it may be used to link genetic findings (in the PF domain) about a microbe to the original culture of that microbe (in MB), or to susceptibility records (in MS) if needed.

MSTESTCD.label: Short Name of Assessment
MSTESTCD.description: Short character value for MSTEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in MSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). MSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "MIC" for Minimum Inhibitory Concentration; "MICROSUS" for Microbial Susceptibility.

MSTEST.label: Name of Assessment
MSTEST.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in MSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Minimum Inhibitory Concentration", "Microbial Susceptibility".

MSAGENT.label: Agent Name
MSAGENT.description: The name of the agent for which resistance is tested. The agent specified may be based on genetic markers or direct phenotypic drug sensitivity testing. Examples: "Penicillin", name of study drug.

MSCONC.label: Agent Concentration
MSCONC.description: Numeric concentration of agent listed in MSAGENT.

MSCONCU.label: Agent Concentration Units
MSCONCU.description: Units for value of the agent concentration listed in MSCONC. Example: "mg/L".

MSTSTDTL.label: Measurement, Test or Examination Detail
MSTSTDTL.description: Further description of MSTESTCD and MSTEST.

MSCAT.label: Category
MSCAT.description: Used to define a category of MSTEST values.

MSSCAT.label: Subcategory
MSSCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of MSCAT values.

MSORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
MSORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

MSSTRESC.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
MSSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from MSORRES in a standard format or in standard units. MSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MSSTRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in MSORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in MSSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".

MSSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
MSSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MSSTRESC. MSSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

MSSTRESU.label: Standard Units
MSSTRESU.description: Standardized units used for MSSTRESC and MSSTRESN. Example: "mol/L".

MSNRIND.label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator
MSNRIND.description: Used to indicate the value is outside the normal range or reference range. May be defined by MSORNRLO and MSORNRHI or other objective criteria. Examples: "Y", "N", "HIGH", "LOW", "NORMAL". "ABNORMAL".

MSRESCAT.label: Result Category
MSRESCAT.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding. In SDTMIG v3.2, MSRESCAT was used to categorize a numeric susceptibility result represented in MSORRES as either "SUSCEPTIBLE", "INTERMEDIATE", or "RESISTANT". However, results from some susceptibility tests may report only a categorical result and not a numeric result. Thus, in order for susceptibility results to be represented consistently, MSRESCAT should no longer be used for this purpose. In this version, the core designation has been changed from Expected to Permissible.

MSSTAT.label: Completion Status
MSSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

MSREASND.label: Reason Not Done
MSREASND.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with MSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

MSNAM.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
MSNAM.description: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

MSLOINC.label: LOINC Code
MSLOINC.description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) code for the topic variable such as a lab test.

MSSPEC.label: Specimen Material Type
MSSPEC.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Example: "SPUTUM".

MSSPCCND.label: Specimen Condition
MSSPCCND.description: Defines the condition of the specimen. Example: "CLOUDY".

MSLOC.label: Location Used for the Measurement
MSLOC.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement.

MSLAT.label: Laterality
MSLAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".

MSDIR.label: Directionality
MSDIR.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".

MSMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
MSMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "EPSILOMETER", "MACRO BROTH DILUTION".

MSANMETH.label: Analysis Method
MSANMETH.description: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result (e.g., an image or a genetic sequence).

MSLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
MSLOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

MSBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
MSBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that MSBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

MSFAST.label: Fasting Status
MSFAST.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Valid values include "Y", "N", "U", or null if not relevant.

MSDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
MSDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.

MSEVAL.label: Evaluator
MSEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "MICROSCOPIST".

MSEVALID.label: Evaluator Identifier
MSEVALID.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in MSEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1" or "RADIOLOGIST2".

MSACPTFL.label: Accepted Record Flag
MSACPTFL.description: In cases where more than 1 assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response, this flag identifies the record that is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted evaluation. Expected to be "Y" or null.

MSLLOQ.label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
MSLLOQ.description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for MSSTRESU.

MSULOQ.label: Upper Limit of Quantitation
MSULOQ.description: Indicates the upper limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for MSSTRESU.

MSREPNUM.label: Repetition Number
MSREPNUM.description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Examples: multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the specimen was collected.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the specimen was collected.

MSDTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
MSDTC.description: Collection date and time of an observation.

MSDY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
MSDY.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

MSDUR.label: Duration
MSDUR.description: Collected duration of an event, intervention, or finding. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived.

MSTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
MSTPT.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., time of last dose). See MSTPTNUM and MSTPTREF.

MSTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
MSTPTNUM.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.

MSELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
MSELTM.description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (MSTPTREF; e.g., previous dose, previous meal). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.

MSTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
MSTPTREF.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by MSELTM, MSTPTNUM, and MSTPT. Example: "PREVIOUS DOSE".

MSRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
MSRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by MSTPTREF.

MSEVLINT.label: Evaluation Interval
MSEVLINT.description: Duration of interval associated with an observation such as a finding MSTESTCD. Example: "-P2M" to represent a period of the past 2 months before the assessment.

MSEVINTX.label: Evaluation Interval Text
MSEVINTX.description: Evaluation interval associated with an observation, where the interval is not able to be represented in ISO 8601 format. Examples: "LIFETIME", "LAST NIGHT", "RECENTLY", "OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS".

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

FOCID.label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest
FOCID.description: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed, such as a drug application site (e.g., "Injection site 1", "Biopsy site 1", "Treated site 1") or a more specific focus (e.g., "OD" (right eye), "Upper left quadrant of the back"). The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning.

NVSEQ.label: Sequence Number
NVSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

NVGRPID.label: Group ID
NVGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

NVSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
NVSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number from the Procedure or Test page.

NVLNKID.label: Link ID
NVLNKID.description: Identifier used to link a procedure to the assessment results over the course of the study.

NVLNKGRP.label: Link Group
NVLNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

NVTESTCD.label: Short Name of Nervous System Test
NVTESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in NVTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in NVTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). NVTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "SUVR", "N75LAT", "P100LAT","N145LAT".

NVTEST.label: Name of Nervous System Test
NVTEST.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in NVTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Standard Uptake Value Ratio", "N75 Latency", "P100 Latency", "N145 Latency".

NVCAT.label: Category for Nervous System Test
NVCAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: "VISUAL EVOKED POTENTIAL".

NVSCAT.label: Subcategory for Nervous System Test
NVSCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of NVCAT values.

NVORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
NVORRES.description: Result of the procedure measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

NVORRESU.label: Original Units
NVORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for NVORRES.

NVSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
NVSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from NVORRES, in a standard format or standard units. NVSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in NVSTRESN.

NVSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
NVSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from NVSTRESC. NVSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

NVSTRESU.label: Standard Units
NVSTRESU.description: Standardized unit used for NVSTRESC or NVSTRESN.

NVSTAT.label: Completion Status
NVSTAT.description: Used to indicate a test was not done, or a measurement was not taken. Should be null if a result exists in NVORRES.

NVREASND.label: Reason Not Done
NVREASND.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with NVSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

NVLOC.label: Location Used for the Measurement
NVLOC.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "BRAIN", "EYE", "PRECUNEUS", "CINGULATE CORTEX".

NVLAT.label: Laterality
NVLAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".

NVDIR.label: Directionality
NVDIR.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".

NVMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
NVMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "EEG", "PET/CT SCAN ", "FDGPET".

NVLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
NVLOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

NVBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
NVBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that NVBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

NVDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
NVDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.

NVEVAL.label: Evaluator
NVEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".

NVEVALID.label: Evaluator Identifier
NVEVALID.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in NVEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2".

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.

NVDY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
NVDY.description: Study day of the procedure or test, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

NVTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
NVTPT.description: Text description of time when measurement should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., "TIME OF LAST DOSE"). See NVTPTNUM and NVTPTREF. Examples: "START", "5 MIN POST".

NVTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
NVTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of NVTPT to aid in sorting.

NVELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
NVELTM.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a fixed time point reference (NVTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by NVTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by NVTPTREF.

NVTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
NVTPTREF.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by NVELTM, NVTPTNUM, and NVTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

NVRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
NVRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

FOCID.label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest
FOCID.description: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed.

OESEQ.label: Sequence Number
OESEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

OEGRPID.label: Group ID
OEGRPID.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

OELNKID.label: Link ID
OELNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.

OELNKGRP.label: Link Group
OELNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

OETESTCD.label: Short Name of Ophthalmic Test or Exam
OETESTCD.description: Short character value for OETEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in OETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). OETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Example: "NUMLCOR".

OETEST.label: Name of Ophthalmic Test or Exam
OETEST.description: Long name for the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in OETEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Number of Letters Correct" for OETESTCD = "NUMLCOR".

OETSTDTL.label: Ophthalmic Test or Exam Detail
OETSTDTL.description: Further description of OETESTCD and OETEST.

OECAT.label: Category for Ophthalmic Test or Exam
OECAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Examples: "VISUAL ACUITY", "CONTRAST SENSITIVITY", "OCULAR COMFORT".

OESCAT.label: Subcategory for Ophthalmic Test or Exam
OESCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of OECAT values. Example: "HIGH CONTRAST" or "LOW CONTRAST" when OECAT is "VISUAL ACUITY".

OEORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
OEORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples: "120", "<1, NORMAL", "RED SPOT VISIBLE".

OEORNRLO.label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Original Units
OEORNRLO.description: Lower end of normal range or reference range for results stored in OEORRES.

OEORNRHI.label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Original Units
OEORNRHI.description: Upper end of normal range or reference range for results stored in OEORRES.

OESTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
OESTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from OEORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. OESTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in OESTRESN.

OESTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
OESTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from OESTRESC. OESTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

OESTRESU.label: Standard Units
OESTRESU.description: Standardized units used for OESTRESC and OESTRESN. Examples: "mm", "um".

OESTNRLO.label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Standard Units
OESTNRLO.description: Lower end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., OESTRESC, OESTRESN) represented in standardized units (OESTRESU).

OESTNRHI.label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Standard Units
OESTNRHI.description: Upper end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., OESTRESC, OESTRESN) represented in standardized units (OESTRESU).

OESTNRC.label: Normal Range for Character Results
OESTNRC.description: Normal range or reference range for results stored in OESTRESC that are character in ordinal or categorical scale. Example: "Negative to Trace".

OENRIND.label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator
OENRIND.description: Used to indicate the value is outside the normal range or reference range. May be defined by OEORNRLO and OEORNRHI or other objective criteria. Examples: "Y", "N"; "HIGH", "LOW"; "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL".

OERESCAT.label: Result Category
OERESCAT.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding or medical status per interpretation of test results. Examples: "POSITIVE", "NEGATIVE". The variable OERESCAT is not meant to replace the use of OENRIND for cases where normal ranges are provided.

OESTAT.label: Completion Status
OESTAT.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

OEREASND.label: Reason Not Done
OEREASND.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with OESTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

OEXFN.label: External File Path
OEXFN.description: Filename for an external file, such as one for a retinal OCT image.

OELOC.label: Location Used for the Measurement
OELOC.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "EYE" for a finding record relative to the complete eye, "RETINA" for a measurement or assessment of only the retina.

OELAT.label: Laterality
OELAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".

OEDIR.label: Directionality
OEDIR.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".

OEPORTOT.label: Portion or Totality
OEPORTOT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of). Examples: "ENTIRE", "SINGLE", "SEGMENT", "MANY".

OEMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
OEMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination. Example: "ETDRS EYE CHART" for OETESTCD = "NUMLCOR". The different methods may offer different functionality or granularity, affecting the set of results and associated meaning.

OELOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
OELOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

OEBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
OEBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that OEBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

OEDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
OEDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.

OEEVAL.label: Evaluator
OEEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "INVESTIGATOR".

OEEVALID.label: Evaluator Identifier
OEEVALID.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in OEEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2".

OEACPTFL.label: Accepted Record Flag
OEACPTFL.description: In cases where more than one assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response, this flag identifies the record that is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted evaluation. Expected to be "Y" or null.

OEREPNUM.label: Repetition Number
OEREPNUM.description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Examples: multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.

OEDY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
OEDY.description: Actual study day of observation/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

OETPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
OETPT.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point.

OETPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
OETPTNUM.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.

OEELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
OEELTM.description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (OETPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.

OETPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
OETPTREF.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by OETPT, OETPTNUM, and OEELTM.

OERFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
OERFTDTC.description: Date/time of the reference time point, OETPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

PCSEQ.label: Sequence Number
PCSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

PCGRPID.label: Group ID
PCGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain to support relationships within the domain and between domains.

PCTESTCD.label: Pharmacokinetic Test Short Name
PCTESTCD.description: Short name of the analyte or specimen characteristic. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in PCTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). PCTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "ASA", "VOL", "SPG".

PCTEST.label: Pharmacokinetic Test Name
PCTEST.description: Name of the analyte or specimen characteristic. Note any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test. The value in PCTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Acetylsalicylic Acid", "Volume", "Specific Gravity".

PCCAT.label: Test Category
PCCAT.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "ANALYTE", "SPECIMEN PROPERTY".

PCSCAT.label: Test Subcategory
PCSCAT.description: A further categorization of a test category.

PCORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
PCORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

PCORRESU.label: Original Units
PCORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for PCORRES. Example: "mg/L".

PCSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
PCSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from PCORRES in a standard format or standard units. PCSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in PCSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in PCORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in PCSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". For other examples, see general assumptions.

PCSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
PCSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from PCSTRESC. PCSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

PCSTRESU.label: Standard Units
PCSTRESU.description: Standardized unit used for PCSTRESC and PCSTRESN.

PCSTAT.label: Completion Status
PCSTAT.description: Used to indicate a result was not obtained. Should be null if a result exists in PCORRES.

PCREASND.label: Reason Test Not Done
PCREASND.description: Describes why a result was not obtained, such as "SPECIMEN LOST". Used in conjunction with PCSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

PCNAM.label: Vendor Name
PCNAM.description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor who provides the test results.

PCSPEC.label: Specimen Material Type
PCSPEC.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "SERUM", "PLASMA", "URINE".

PCSPCCND.label: Specimen Condition
PCSPCCND.description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen. Examples: "HEMOLYZED", "ICTERIC", "LIPEMIC".

PCMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
PCMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "HPLC/MS", "ELISA". This should contain sufficient information and granularity to allow differentiation of various methods that might have been used within a study.

PCFAST.label: Fasting Status
PCFAST.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status.

PCDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
PCDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, which do not come from the CRF, are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If PCDRVFL = "Y", then PCORRES may be null with PCSTRESC, and PCSTRESN (if the result is numeric) having the derived value.

PCLLOQ.label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
PCLLOQ.description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units should be those used in PCSTRESU.

PCULOQ.label: Upper Limit of Quantitation
PCULOQ.description: Indicates the upper limit of quantitation for an assay. Units should be those used in PCSTRESU.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected.

PCDTC.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
PCDTC.description: Date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format. If there is no end time, then this will be the collection time.

PCENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Specimen Collection
PCENDTC.description: End date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format. If there is no end time, the collection time should be stored in PCDTC, and PCENDTC should be null.

PCDY.label: Actual Study Day of Specimen Collection
PCDY.description: Study day of specimen collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

PCENDY.label: Study Day of End of Observation
PCENDY.description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

PCTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
PCTPT.description: Text description of time when specimen should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See PCTPTNUM and PCTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post".

PCTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
PCTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of PCTPT to aid in sorting.

PCELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
PCELTM.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (PCTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable.

PCTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
PCTPTREF.description: Name of the fixed reference point used as a basis for PCTPT, PCTPTNUM, and PCELTM. Example: "MOST RECENT DOSE".

PCRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Point
PCRFTDTC.description: Date/time of the reference time point described by PCTPTREF.

PCEVLINT.label: Evaluation Interval
PCEVLINT.description: Evaluation Interval associated with a PCTEST record represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: "-PT2H" to represent an evaluation interval of 2 hours prior to a PCTPT.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

PESEQ.label: Sequence Number
PESEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number.

PEGRPID.label: Group ID
PEGRPID.description: Used to link together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

PESPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
PESPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a CRF.

PETESTCD.label: Body System Examined Short Name
PETESTCD.description: Short name of a part of the body examined in a physical examination. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in PETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). PETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "HEAD", "ENT". If the results of the entire physical examination are represented in one record, value should be "PHYSEXAM".

PETEST.label: Body System Examined
PETEST.description: Long name of a part of the body examined in a physical examination. The value in PETEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Head", "Ear/Nose/Throat". If the results of the entire physical examination are represented in one record, value should be "Physical Examination".

PEMODIFY.label: Modified Reported Term
PEMODIFY.description: If the value of PEORRES is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

PECAT.label: Category for Examination
PECAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: "GENERAL".

PESCAT.label: Subcategory for Examination
PESCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values.

PEBODSYS.label: Body System or Organ Class
PEBODSYS.description: Body system or organ class (e.g., MedDRA SOC) that is involved for a finding from the standard hierarchy for dictionary-coded results.

PEORRES.label: Verbatim Examination Finding
PEORRES.description: Text description of any abnormal findings. If the examination was completed and there were no abnormal findings, the value should be "NORMAL". If the examination was not performed on a particular body system, or at the subject level, then the value should be null, and "NOT DONE" should appear in PESTAT.

PEORRESU.label: Original Units
PEORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for PEORRES.

PESTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
PESTRESC.description: If there are findings for a body system, then either the dictionary preferred term (if findings are coded using a dictionary) or PEORRES (if findings are not encoded) should appear here. If PEORRES is null, PESTRESC must be null.

PESTAT.label: Completion Status
PESTAT.description: Used to indicate exam not done. Must be null if a result exists in PEORRES/PESTRESC.

PEREASND.label: Reason Not Examined
PEREASND.description: Describes why an examination was not performed or why a body system was not examined. Example: "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with PESTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

PELOC.label: Location of Physical Exam Finding
