PELOC.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Example: "ARM" for skin rash.

PELAT.label: Laterality
PELAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterallity. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".

PEMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
PEMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "PALPATION", "PERCUSSION".

PELOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
PELOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null.

PEBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
PEBLFL.description: A baseline defined by the sponsor (could be derived in the same manner as PELOBXFL or ABLFL, but is not required to be). The value should be "Y" or null. Note that PEBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

PEEVAL.label: Evaluator
PEEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Example: "INVESTIGATOR".

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the observation date/time of the physical exam finding.

PEDTC.label: Date/Time of Examination
PEDTC.description: Date and time of the physical examination represented in ISO 8601 character format.

PEDY.label: Study Day of Examination
PEDY.description: Study day of physical exam, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. \n

PPSEQ.label: Sequence Number
PPSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

PPGRPID.label: Group ID
PPGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain to support relationships within the domain and between domains.

PPTESTCD.label: Parameter Short Name
PPTESTCD.description: Short name of the pharmacokinetic parameter. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in PPTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). PPTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "AUCALL", "TMAX", "CMAX".

PPTEST.label: Parameter Name
PPTEST.description: Name of the pharmacokinetic parameter. The value in PPTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "AUC All", "Time of CMAX", "Max Conc".

PPCAT.label: Parameter Category
PPCAT.description: Used to define a category of related records. For PP, this should be the name of the analyte in PCTEST whose profile the parameter is associated with.

PPSCAT.label: Parameter Subcategory
PPSCAT.description: Categorization of the model type used to calculate the PK parameters. Examples: "COMPARTMENTAL", "NON-COMPARTMENTAL".

PPORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
PPORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

PPORRESU.label: Original Units
PPORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for PPORRES. Example: "ng/L". See PP Assumption 3.

PPSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
PPSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from PPORRES in a standard format or standard units. PPSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in PPSTRESN.

PPSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
PPSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from PPSTRESC. PPSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

PPSTRESU.label: Standard Units
PPSTRESU.description: Standardized unit used for PPSTRESC and PPSTRESN. See PP Assumption 3.

PPSTAT.label: Completion Status
PPSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a parameter was not calculated. Should be null if a result exists in PPORRES.

PPREASND.label: Reason Parameter Not Calculated
PPREASND.description: Describes why a parameter was not calculated, such as "INSUFFICIENT DATA". Used in conjunction with PPSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

PPSPEC.label: Specimen Material Type
PPSPEC.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. If multiple specimen types are used for a calculation (e.g., serum and urine for renal clearance), then this field should be left blank. Examples: "SERUM", "PLASMA", "URINE".

PPANMETH.label: Analysis Method
PPANMETH.description: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result. Example: A named formula used to calculate AUC, such as "LIN-LOG TRAPEZOIDAL METHOD". \n Sponsor-defined formulas can also be represented by this variable. Example: Calculating ratio AUCs where the PPANMETH may be "DRUG METABOLITE 1 TO DRUG PARENT" or "DRUG METABOLITE 2 TO METABOLITE 1".

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected.

PPDY.label: Study Day of Parameter Calculations
PPDY.description: Study day of the collection, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.

PPTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
PPTPTREF.description: The description of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for a series of planned time points.

PPRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Point
PPRFTDTC.description: Date/time of the reference time point from the PC records used to calculate a parameter record. The values in PPRFTDTC should be the same as that in PCRFTDTC for related records.

PPSTINT.label: Planned Start of Assessment Interval
PPSTINT.description: The start of a planned evaluation or assessment interval relative to the time point reference.

PPENINT.label: Planned End of Assessment Interval
PPENINT.description: The end of a planned evaluation or assessment interval relative to the time point reference.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

QSSEQ.label: Sequence Number
QSSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

QSGRPID.label: Group ID
QSGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

QSSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
QSSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Question number on a questionnaire.

QSTESTCD.label: Question Short Name
QSTESTCD.description: Topic variable for QS. Short name for the value in QSTEST, which can be used as a column name when converting the dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The value in QSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). QSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. \n Controlled terminology for QSTESTCD is published in separate codelists for each questionnaire. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/semantics/terminology for values for QSTESTCD. Examples: "ADCCMD01", "BPR0103".

QSTEST.label: Question Name
QSTEST.description: Verbatim name of the question or group of questions used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in QSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. \n Controlled terminology for QSTEST is published in separate codelists for each questionnaire. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/semantics/terminology for values for QSTEST. Example: "BPR01 - Emotional Withdrawal".

QSCAT.label: Category of Question
QSCAT.description: Used to specify the questionnaire in which the question identified by QSTEST and QSTESTCD was included. Examples: "ADAS-COG", "MDS-UPDRS".

QSSCAT.label: Subcategory for Question
QSSCAT.description: A further categorization of the questions within the category. Examples: "MENTAL HEALTH" , "DEPRESSION", "WORD RECALL".

QSORRES.label: Finding in Original Units
QSORRES.description: Finding as originally received or collected (e.g., "RARELY", "SOMETIMES"). When sponsors apply codelist to indicate that code values are statistically meaningful standardized scores (which are defined by sponsors or by valid methodologies, e.g., SF36 questionnaires), QSORRES will contain the decode format; QSSTRESC and QSSTRESN may contain the standardized code values or scores.

QSORRESU.label: Original Units
QSORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for QSORRES, such as minutes or seconds or the units associated with a visual analog scale.

QSSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
QSSTRESC.description: Contains the finding for all questions or subscores copied or derived from QSORRES, in a standard format or standard units. QSSTRESC should store all findings in character format; if findings are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in QSSTRESN. If question scores are derived from the original finding, then the standard format is the score. Examples: "0", "1". \n When sponsors apply codelist to indicate the code values are statistically meaningful standardized scores (which are defined by sponsors or by valid methodologies, e.g., SF36 questionnaires), QSORRES will contain the decode format; QSSTRESC and QSSTRESN may contain the standardized code values or scores.

QSSTRESN.label: Numeric Finding in Standard Units
QSSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from QSSTRESC. QSSTRESN should store all numeric results or findings.

QSSTRESU.label: Standard Units
QSSTRESU.description: Standardized unit used for QSSTRESC or QSSTRESN.

QSSTAT.label: Completion Status
QSSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a question was not done or was not answered. Should be null if a result exists in QSORRES.

QSREASND.label: Reason Not Performed
QSREASND.description: Describes why a question was not answered. Used in conjunction with QSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". Example: "SUBJECT REFUSED".

QSMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
QSMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination.

QSLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
QSLOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null.

QSBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
QSBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that QSBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

QSDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
QSDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records or questionnaire subscores that do not come from the CRF are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If QSDRVFL = "Y", then QSORRES may be null with QSSTRESC and (if numeric) QSSTRESN having the derived value.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the observation date/time of the physical exam finding.

QSDY.label: Study Day of Finding
QSDY.description: Study day of finding collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

QSTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
QSTPT.description: Text description of time when questionnaire should be administered. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., "TIME OF LAST DOSE"). See QSTPTNUM and QSTPTREF.

QSTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
QSTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of QSTPT to aid in sorting.

QSELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
QSELTM.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (QSTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by QSTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by QSTPTREF.

QSTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
QSTPTREF.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by QSELTM, QSTPTNUM, and QSTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

QSRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
QSRFTDTC.description: Date/time of the reference time point, QSTPTREF.

QSEVLINT.label: Evaluation Interval
QSEVLINT.description: Evaluation interval associated with a QSTEST question represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: "-P2Y" to represent an interval of 2 years in the question "Have you experienced any episodes in the past 2 years?".

QSEVINTX.label: Evaluation Interval Text
QSEVINTX.description: Evaluation interval associated with an observation, where the interval is not able to be represented in ISO 8601 format. Examples: "LIFETIME", "LAST NIGHT", "RECENTLY", "OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS".

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

RESEQ.label: Sequence Number
RESEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.

REGRPID.label: Group ID
REGRPID.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

REREFID.label: Reference ID
REREFID.description: Optional internal or external procedure identifier.

RESPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
RESPID.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.

RELNKID.label: Link ID
RELNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.

RELNKGRP.label: Link Group
RELNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

RETESTCD.label: Short Name of Respiratory Test
RETESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The value in RETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). RETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "FEV1", "FVC".

RETEST.label: Name of Respiratory Test
RETEST.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in RETEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second", "Forced Vital Capacity".

RECAT.label: Category for Respiratory Test
RECAT.description: Used to categorize observations across subjects.

REPOS.label: Position of Subject During Observation
REPOS.description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING".

REORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
REORRES.description: Result of the procedure measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

REORRESU.label: Original Units
REORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for REORRES and REORREF.

REORREF.label: Reference Result in Original Units
REORREF.description: Reference result for continuous measurements in original units. Should be collected only for continuous results.

RESTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
RESTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from REORRES in a standard format or in standard units. RESTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in RESTRESN.

RESTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
RESTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from RESTRESC. RESTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

RESTRESU.label: Standard Units
RESTRESU.description: Standardized unit used for RESTRESC, RESTRESN and RESTREFN.

RESTREFC.label: Character Reference Result
RESTREFC.description: Reference value for the result or finding copied or derived from --ORREF in a standard format.

RESTREFN.label: Numeric Reference Result in Std Units
RESTREFN.description: Reference result for continuous measurements in standard units. Should be populated only for continuous results.

RESTAT.label: Completion Status
RESTAT.description: Used to indicate that a test was not done or a measurement was not taken. Should be null if a result exists in REORRES.

REREASND.label: Reason Not Done
REREASND.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with RESTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

RELOC.label: Location Used for the Measurement
RELOC.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "LUNG", "BRONCHUS".

RELAT.label: Laterality
RELAT.description: Side of the body used to collect measurement. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT".

REDIR.label: Directionality
REDIR.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".

REMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
REMETHOD.description: Method used to create the result.

RELOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
RELOBXFL.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

REBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
REBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be Y or null. Note that REBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

REDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
REDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record. Should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or that do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally collected or received are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If REDRVFL = "Y", then REORRES could be null, with RESTRESC and (if numeric) RESTRESN having the derived value.

REEVAL.label: Evaluator
REEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".

REEVALID.label: Evaluator Identifier
REEVALID.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in REEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2".

REREPNUM.label: Repetition Number
REREPNUM.description: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given time frame for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Example: multiple measurements of pulmonary function.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.

REDY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
REDY.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

RETPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
RETPT.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., "TIME OF LAST DOSE"). See RETPTNUM and RETPTREF. Examples: "START", "5 MINUTES POST".

RETPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
RETPTNUM.description: Numeric version of RETPT to aid in sorting.

REELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
REELTM.description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (RETPTREF). Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent 15 minutes prior to the reference time point indicated by RETPTREF, "PT8H" to represent 8 hours after the reference time point represented by RETPTREF.

RETPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
RETPTREF.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by REELTM, RETPTNUM, and RETPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

RERFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
RERFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by RETPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

RPSEQ.label: Sequence Number
RPSEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject (or within a parameter, in the case of the Trial Summary domain). May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.

RPGRPID.label: Group ID
RPGRPID.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. Also used to link together a block of related records in the Trial Summary dataset.

RPREFID.label: Reference ID
RPREFID.description: Optional internal or external identifier (e.g., lab specimen ID, UUID for an ECG waveform or a medical image).

RPSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
RPSPID.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: Preprinted line identifier on a CRF.

RPLNKID.label: Link ID
RPLNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.

RPLNKGRP.label: Link Group ID
RPLNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

RPTESTCD.label: Short Name of Reproductive Test
RPTESTCD.description: Short character value for RPTEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters. Examples: "CHILDPOT", "BCMETHOD", "MENARAGE".

RPTEST.label: Name of Reproductive Test
RPTEST.description: Long name For RPTESTCD. Examples: "Childbearing Potential", "Birth Control Method", "Menarche Age".

RPCAT.label: Category for Reproductive Test
RPCAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: "No use case to date, but values would be relative to reproduction tests grouping".

RPSCAT.label: Subcategory for Reproductive Test
RPSCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of RPCAT values. Example: "No use case to date, but values would be relative to reproduction tests grouping".

RPORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
RPORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples: "120", "<1", "POS".

RPSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
RPSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from RPORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. RPSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in RPSTRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in RPORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in RPSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".

RPSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
RPSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from RPSTRESC. RPSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

RPSTRESU.label: Standard Units
RPSTRESU.description: Standardized units used for RPSTRESC and RPSTRESN. Example: "mol/L".

RPSTAT.label: Completion Status
RPSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

RPREASND.label: Reason Not Done
RPREASND.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with RPSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

RPLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
RPLOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

RPBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
RPBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that RPBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

RPDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
RPDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records which represent the average of other records or which do not come from the CRF are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If RPDRVFL = "Y", then RPORRES may be null, with RPSTRESC and (if numeric) RPSTRESN having the derived value.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.

RPDTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
RPDTC.description: Collection date and time of an observation.

RPDY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
RPDY.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

RPDUR.label: Duration
RPDUR.description: Collected duration of an event, intervention, or finding represented in ISO 8601 character format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived.

RPTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
RPTPT.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose.

RPTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
RPTPTNUM.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.

RPELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
RPELTM.description: Planned elapsed time in ISO 8601 character format relative to a planned fixed reference (RPTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.

RPTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
RPTPTREF.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by RPELTM, RPTPTNUM, and RPTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

RPRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
RPRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by RPTPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

RSSEQ.label: Sequence Number
RSSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number.

RSGRPID.label: Group ID
RSGRPID.description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

RSLNKID.label: Link ID
RSLNKID.description: An identifier used to link the response assessment to the related measurement record in another domain which was used to determine the response result. LNKID values group records within USUBJID.

RSLNKGRP.label: Link Group ID
RSLNKGRP.description: A grouping identifier used to link the response assessment to a group of measurement/assessment records which were used in the assessment of the response. LNKGRP values group records within USUBJID.

RSTESTCD.label: Assessment Short Name
RSTESTCD.description: Short name of the TEST in RSTEST. The value in RSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). RSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "TRGRESP", "NTRGRESP", "OVRLRESP", "SYMPTDTR", "CPS0102". \n There are separate codelists used for RSTESTCD where the choice depends on the value of RSCAT. Codelist "ONCRTSCD" is used for oncology response criteria (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "ONCRSCAT"). Examples: TRGRESP, "NTRGRESP, "OVRLRESP". For Clinical Classifications (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "CCCAT"), QRS Naming Rules apply. These instruments have individual dedicated terminology codelists.

RSTEST.label: Assessment Name
RSTEST.description: Verbatim name of the response assessment. The value in RSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. \n There are separate codelists used for RSTEST where the choice depends on the value of RSCAT. Codelist "ONCRTS" is used for oncology response criteria (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "ONCRSCAT"). Examples: "Target Response", "Non-target Response", "Overall Response", "Symptomatic Deterioration". For Clinical Classifications (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "CCCAT"), QRS Naming Rules apply. These instruments have individual dedicated terminology codelists.

RSCAT.label: Category for Assessment
RSCAT.description: Used to define a category of related records across subjects. Examples: "RECIST 1.1", "CHILD-PUGH CLASSIFICATION". There are separate codelists used for RSCAT where the choice depends on whether the related records are about an oncology response criterion or another clinical classification. \n RSCAT is required for clinical classifications other than oncology response criteria.

RSSCAT.label: Subcategory
RSSCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of RSCAT values.

RSORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
RSORRES.description: Result of the response assessment as originally received, collected, or calculated.

RSSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
RSSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for the response assessment, copied, or derived from RSORRES in a standard format or standard units. RSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format. \n For Clinical Classifications, this may be a score.

RSSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
RSSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from --STRESC. --STRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. For Clinical Classifications, this may be a score.

RSSTRESU.label: Standard Units
RSSTRESU.description: Standardized units used for RSSTRESC and RSSTRESN.

RSSTAT.label: Completion Status
RSSTAT.description: Used to indicate the response assessment was not performed. Should be null if a result exists in RSORRES.

RSREASND.label: Reason Not Done
RSREASND.description: Describes why a response assessment was not performed. Examples: "All target tumors not evaluated", "Subject does not have non-target tumors". Used in conjunction with RSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

RSNAM.label: Vendor Name
RSNAM.description: The name or identifier of the vendor that performed the response assessment. This column can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain.

RSMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
RSMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination.

RSLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
RSLOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. \n When a clinical classification is assessed at multiple times, including baseline, RSLOBXFL should be included in the dataset.

RSBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
RSBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that --BLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

RSDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
RSDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.

RSEVAL.label: Evaluator
RSEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST". \n RSEVAL is expected for oncology response criteria. It can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain. However, the column should contain no null values when data from one or more independent assessors is included, meaning that the rows attributed to the investigator should contain a value of "INVESTIGATOR".

RSEVALID.label: Evaluator Identifier
RSEVALID.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in RSEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2". See assumptions in Section 6.3.9.3.1, Disease Response Use Case.

RSACPTFL.label: Accepted Record Flag
RSACPTFL.description: In cases where more than 1 independent assessor (e.g., "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2", "ADJUDICATOR") provides an evaluation of response, this flag identifies the record that is considered to be the accepted evaluation.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.

RSDTC.label: Date/Time of Assessment
RSDTC.description: Collection date and time of the assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format.

RSDY.label: Study Day of Assessment
RSDY.description: Study day of the assessment, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

RSTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
RSTPT.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See RSTPTNUM and RSTPTREF.

RSTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
RSTPTNUM.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.

RSELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
RSELTM.description: Planned elapsed time in ISO 8601 character format relative to a planned fixed reference (RSTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.

RSTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
RSTPTREF.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by RSELTM, RSTPTNUM, and RSTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

RSRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
RSRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by RSTPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.

RSEVLINT.label: Evaluation Interval
RSEVLINT.description: Duration of interval associated with an observation such as a finding RSTESTCD, represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: "-P2M" to represent a period of the past 2 months as the evaluation interval.

RSEVINTX.label: Evaluation Interval Text
RSEVINTX.description: Evaluation interval associated with an observation, where the interval is not able to be represented in ISO 8601 format. Examples: "LIFETIME", "LAST NIGHT", "RECENTLY", "OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS".

RSSTRTPT.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
RSSTRTPT.description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable RSSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

RSSTTPT.label: Start Reference Time Point
RSSTTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by RSSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1".

RSENRTPT.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
RSENRTPT.description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable RSENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

RSENTPT.label: End Reference Time Point
RSENTPT.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by RSENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

SCSEQ.label: Sequence Number
SCSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

SCGRPID.label: Group ID
SCGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

SCSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SCSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.

SCTESTCD.label: Subject Characteristic Short Name
SCTESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in SCTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in SCTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). SCTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "MARISTAT", "NATORIG".

SCTEST.label: Subject Characteristic
SCTEST.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in SCTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Marital Status", "National Origin".

SCCAT.label: Category for Subject Characteristic
SCCAT.description: Used to define a category of related records.

SCSCAT.label: Subcategory for Subject Characteristic
SCSCAT.description: A further categorization of the subject characteristic.

SCORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SCORRES.description: Result of the subject characteristic as originally received or collected.

SCORRESU.label: Original Units
SCORRESU.description: Original unit in which the data were collected. The unit for SCORRES.

SCSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SCSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from SCORRES, in a standard format or standard units. SCSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in SCSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in SCORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in SCSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".

SCSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SCSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from SCSTRESC. SCSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

SCSTRESU.label: Standard Units
SCSTRESU.description: Standardized unit used for SCSTRESC or SCSTRESN.

SCSTAT.label: Completion Status
SCSTAT.description: Used to indicate that the measurement was not done. Should be null if a result exists in SCORRES.

SCREASND.label: Reason Not Performed
SCREASND.description: Describes why the observation has no result. Example: "Subject refused". Used in conjunction with SCSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time at which the assessment was made.

SCDTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
SCDTC.description: Collection date and time of the subject characteristic represented in ISO 8601 character format.

SCDY.label: Study Day of Examination
SCDY.description: Study day of collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

SSSEQ.label: Sequence Number
SSSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

SSGRPID.label: Group ID
SSGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

SSSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SSSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number from the Procedure or Test page.

SSTESTCD.label: Status Short Name
SSTESTCD.description: Short name of the status assessment described in SSTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in SSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). SSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Example: "SURVSTAT".

SSTEST.label: Status Name
SSTEST.description: Verbatim name of the status assessment used to obtain the finding. The value in SSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Survival Status".

SSCAT.label: Category for Assessment
SSCAT.description: Used to categorize observations across subjects.

SSORRES.label: Result or Finding Original Result
SSORRES.description: Result of the status assessment finding as originally received or collected.

SSSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SSSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from SSORRES, in a standard format.

SSSTAT.label: Completion Status
SSSTAT.description: Used to indicate a status assessment was not done. Should be null if a result exists in SSORRES.

SSREASND.label: Reason Assessment Not Performed
SSREASND.description: Describes why an assessment was not performed. Example: "Subject refused". Used in conjunction with SSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

SSEVAL.label: Evaluator
SSEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain collected or derived data. Examples: "CAREGIVER", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "FRIEND".

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the subject status assessment.

SSDTC.label: Date/Time of Assessment
SSDTC.description: Date and time of the subject status assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format.

SSDY.label: Study Day of Assessment
SSDY.description: Study day of the subject status assessment, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

TRSEQ.label: Sequence Number
TRSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number.

TRGRPID.label: Group ID
TRGRPID.description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

TRLNKID.label: Link ID
TRLNKID.description: Identifier used to link the assessment result records to the individual tumor/lesion identification record in TU domain.

TRLNKGRP.label: Link Group
TRLNKGRP.description: Used to group and link all of the measurement/assessment records used in the assessment of the response record in the RS domain.

TRTESTCD.label: Tumor/Lesion Assessment Short Name
TRTESTCD.description: Short name of the TEST in TRTEST. TRTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "TUMSTATE", "DIAMETER", "LESSCIND", "LESRVIND". See assumption 3.

TRTEST.label: Tumor/Lesion Assessment Test Name
TRTEST.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in TRTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Tumor State", "Diameter", "Volume", "Lesion Success Indicator", "Lesion Revascularization Indicator". See assumption 3.

TRORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
TRORRES.description: Result of the tumor/lesion measurement/assessment as originally received or collected.

TRORRESU.label: Original Units
TRORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for TRORRES. Example: "mm".

TRSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
TRSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from TRORRES, in a standard format or standard units. TRSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in TRSTRESN.

TRSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
TRSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from TRSTRESC. TRSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

TRSTAT.label: Completion Status
TRSTAT.description: Used to indicate a scan/image/physical exam was not performed or a tumor/lesion measurement was not taken. Should be null if a result exists in TRORRES.

TRREASND.label: Reason Not Done
TRREASND.description: Describes why a scan/image/physical exam was not performed or a tumor/lesion measurement was not taken. Examples: "SCAN NOT PERFORMED", "NOT ASSESSABLE: IMAGE OBSCURED TUMOR". Used in conjunction with TRSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

TRNAM.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
TRNAM.description: The name or identifier of the vendor that performed the tumor/lesion measurement or assessment. This column can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain.

TRMETHOD.label: Method Used to Identify the Tumor/Lesion
TRMETHOD.description: Method used to measure the tumor/lesion/location of interest. Examples: "MRI", "CT SCAN", "PET SCAN", "Coronary angiography".

TRLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
TRLOBXFL.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null.

TRBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
TRBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that TRBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

TREVAL.label: Evaluator
TREVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR".

TREVALID.label: Evaluator Identifier
TREVALID.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in TREVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2". See assumption 6.

TRACPTFL.label: Accepted Record Flag
TRACPTFL.description: In cases where more than 1 independent assessor (e.g., "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE") provide independent assessments at the same time point, this flag identifies the record that is considered to be the accepted assessment.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the element in the planned sequence of elements for the arm to which the subject was assigned.

TRDTC.label: Date/Time of Tumor/Lesion Measurement
TRDTC.description: The date of the scan/image/physical exam. TRDTC does not represent the date that the image was read to identify tumors/lesions. TRDTC also does not represent the VISIT date.

TRDY.label: Study Day of Tumor/Lesion Measurement
TRDY.description: Study day of the scan/image/physical exam, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

TUSEQ.label: Sequence Number
TUSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number.

TUGRPID.label: Group ID
TUGRPID.description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. Can be used to group split or merged tumors/lesions which have been identified.

TUREFID.label: Reference ID
TUREFID.description: Internal or external identifier (e.g., medical image ID number).

TULNKID.label: Link ID
TULNKID.description: Identifier used to link identified tumor/lesion/location of interest to the assessment results (in TR domain) over the course of the study.

TULNKGRP.label: Link Group ID
TULNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

TUTESTCD.label: Tumor/Lesion ID Short Name
TUTESTCD.description: Short name of the TEST in TUTEST. TUTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters nor can start with a number. TUTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Example: "TUMIDENT". See assumption 3.

TUTEST.label: Tumor/Lesion ID Test Name
TUTEST.description: Verbatim name of the test for the tumor/lesion identification. The value in TUTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Tumor identification". See assumption 3.

TUORRES.label: Tumor/Lesion ID Result
TUORRES.description: Result of the tumor/lesion identification. The result of tumor/lesion identification is a classification of the identified tumor/lesion. Example: When TUTESTCD = "TUMIDENT", values of TUORRES might be "TARGET", "NON-TARGET", "NEW", or "BENIGN ABNORMALITY".

TUSTRESC.label: Tumor/Lesion ID Result Std. Format
TUSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from TUORRES in a standard format.

TUNAM.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
TUNAM.description: The name or identifier of the vendor that performed the tumor/lesion Identification. This column can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain.

TULOC.label: Location of the Tumor/Lesion
TULOC.description: Used to specify the anatomical location of the identified tumor/lesion (e.g., "LIVER"). \n Note: When anatomical location is broken down and collected as distinct pieces of data that when combined provide the overall location information (e.g., laterality/directionality/distribution), then additional anatomical location qualifiers should be used. See assumption 3.

TULAT.label: Laterality
TULAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality (e.g., "LEFT", "RIGHT", "BILATERAL").

TUDIR.label: Directionality
TUDIR.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality (e.g., "UPPER", "INTERIOR").

TUPORTOT.label: Portion or Totality
TUPORTOT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, or apportioning of. Examples: "ENTIRE", "SINGLE", "SEGMENT", "MULTIPLE".

TUMETHOD.label: Method of Identification
TUMETHOD.description: Method used to identify the tumor/lesion. Examples: "MRI", "CT SCAN".

TULOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
TULOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null.

TUBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
TUBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that TUBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

TUEVAL.label: Evaluator
TUEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR". \n This column can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain. However, the column should contain no null values when data from 1 or more independent assessors is included. For example, the rows attributed to the investigator should contain a value of "INVESTIGATOR".

TUEVALID.label: Evaluator Identifier
TUEVALID.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in --EVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2". See assumption 9.

TUACPTFL.label: Accepted Record Flag
TUACPTFL.description: In cases where more than 1 independent assessor (e.g., "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE") provide independent assessments at the same time point, this flag identifies the record that is considered to be the accepted assessment.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. Should be an integer.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.

TUDTC.label: Date/Time of Tumor/Lesion Identification
TUDTC.description: TUDTC variable represents the date of the scan/image/physical exam. TUDTC does not represent the date that the image was read to identify tumors. TUDTC also does not represent the VISIT date.

TUDY.label: Study Day of Tumor/Lesion Identification
TUDY.description: Study day of the scan/image/physical exam, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

URSEQ.label: Sequence Number
URSEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.

URGRPID.label: Group ID
URGRPID.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

URREFID.label: Reference ID
URREFID.description: Optional internal or external identifier (e.g., lab specimen ID, universally unique identifier (UUID) for a medical image).

URSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
URSPID.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: Preprinted line identifier.

URLNKID.label: Link ID
URLNKID.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.

URLNKGRP.label: Link Group ID
URLNKGRP.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.

URTESTCD.label: Short Name of Urinary Test
URTESTCD.description: Short character value for URTEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in URTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). URTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "COUNT", "LENGTH", "RBLDFLW".

URTEST.label: Name of Urinary Test
URTEST.description: Long name For URTESTCD. Examples: "Count", "Length", "Renal Blood Flow".

URTSTDTL.label: Urinary Test Detail
URTSTDTL.description: Further description of URTESTCD and URTEST.

URCAT.label: Category for Urinary Test
URCAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.

URSCAT.label: Subcategory for Urinary Test
URSCAT.description: Used to define a further categorization of URCAT values.

URORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
URORRES.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

URSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
URSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from URORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. URSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in URSTRESN.

URSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
URSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from URSTRESC. URSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

URSTRESU.label: Standard Units
URSTRESU.description: Standardized units used for URSTRESC and URSTRESN.

URRESCAT.label: Result Category
URRESCAT.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding.

URSTAT.label: Completion Status
URSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

URREASND.label: Reason Not Done
URREASND.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with URSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

URLOC.label: Location Used for the Measurement
URLOC.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement.

URLAT.label: Laterality
URLAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".

URDIR.label: Directionality
URDIR.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".

URMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
URMETHOD.description: Method of the test or examination.

URLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
URLOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

URBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
URBLFL.description: A baseline defined by the sponsor The value should be "Y" or null. Note that URBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

URDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
URDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.

UREVAL.label: Evaluator
UREVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".

UREVALID.label: Evaluator Identifier
UREVALID.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in UREVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2".

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the observation was made.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the observation was made.

URDTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
URDTC.description: Collection date and time of an observation.

URDY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
URDY.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

URTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
URTPT.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., time of last dose). See URTPTNUM and URTPTREF.

URTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
URTPTNUM.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.

URELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
URELTM.description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (URTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.

URTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
URTPTREF.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by URELTM, URTPTNUM, and URTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

URRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
URRFTDTC.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by URTPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

VSSEQ.label: Sequence Number
VSSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

VSGRPID.label: Group ID
VSGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

VSSPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
VSSPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.

VSTESTCD.label: Vital Signs Test Short Name
VSTESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in VSTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in VSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). VSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "SYSBP", "DIABP", "BMI".

VSTEST.label: Vital Signs Test Name
VSTEST.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in VSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Systolic Blood Pressure", "Diastolic Blood Pressure", "Body Mass Index".

VSCAT.label: Category for Vital Signs
VSCAT.description: Used to define a category of related records.

VSSCAT.label: Subcategory for Vital Signs
VSSCAT.description: A further categorization of a measurement or examination.

VSPOS.label: Vital Signs Position of Subject
VSPOS.description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING".

VSORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
VSORRES.description: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.

VSORRESU.label: Original Units
VSORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for VSORRES. Examples: "in", "LB", "beats/min".

VSSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
VSSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from VSORRES in a standard format or standard units. VSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in VSSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in VSORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in VSSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".

VSSTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
VSSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from VSSTRESC. VSSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

VSSTRESU.label: Standard Units
VSSTRESU.description: Standardized unit used for VSSTRESC and VSSTRESN.

VSSTAT.label: Completion Status
VSSTAT.description: Used to indicate that a vital sign measurement was not done. Should be null if a result exists in VSORRES.

VSREASND.label: Reason Not Performed
VSREASND.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with VSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

VSLOC.label: Location of Vital Signs Measurement
VSLOC.description: Location relevant to the collection of vital signs measurement. Example: "ARM" for blood pressure.

VSLAT.label: Laterality
VSLAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".

VSLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
VSLOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null.

VSBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
VSBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that VSBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

VSDRVFL.label: Derived Flag
VSDRVFL.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records or that do not come from the CRF are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If VSDRVFL = "Y," then VSORRES may be null, with VSSTRESC and (if numeric) VSSTRESN having the derived value.

VSTOX.label: Toxicity
VSTOX.description: Description of toxicity quantified by VSTOXGR. The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.

VSTOXGR.label: Standard Toxicity Grade
VSTOXGR.description: Records toxicity grade value using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE). If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., "2", not "Grade 2"). The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.

VSCLSIG.label: Clinically Significant, Collected
VSCLSIG.description: Used to indicate whether a collected observation is clinically significant based on judgment.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time at which the assessment was made.

VSDTC.label: Date/Time of Measurements
VSDTC.description: Date and time of the vital signs assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format.

VSDY.label: Study Day of Vital Signs
VSDY.description: Study day of vital signs measurements, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.

VSTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
VSTPT.description: Text description of time when measurement should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., time of last dose). See VSTPTNUM and VSTPTREF. Examples: "START", "5 MIN POST".

VSTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
VSTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of VSTPT to aid in sorting.

VSELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
VSELTM.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (VSTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 Duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by VSTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by VSTPTREF.

VSTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
VSTPTREF.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by VSELTM, VSTPTNUM, and VSTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".

VSRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
VSRFTDTC.description: Date/time of the reference time point, VSTPTREF.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

FASEQ.label: Sequence Number
FASEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

FAGRPID.label: Group ID
FAGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

FASPID.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
FASPID.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a CRF.

FATESTCD.label: Findings About Test Short Name
FATESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in FATEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in FATESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). FATESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "SEV", "OCCUR". Note that controlled terminology is in a FATESTCD general codelist and in several therapeutic area-specific codelists.

FATEST.label: Findings About Test Name
FATEST.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in FATEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Severity/Intensity", "Occurrence". Note that controlled terminology is in a FATEST general codelist and in several therapeutic area-specific codelists.

FAOBJ.label: Object of the Observation
FAOBJ.description: Used to describe the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by --TEST. Examples: the term (e.g., "Acne") describing a clinical sign or symptom that is being measured by a severity test; an event (e.g., "VOMIT, where the volume of vomit is being measured by a VOLUME test).

FACAT.label: Category for Findings About
FACAT.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "GERD", "PRE-SPECIFIED AE".

FAORRES.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
FAORRES.description: Result of the test as originally received or collected.

FAORRESU.label: Original Units
FAORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for FAORRES.

FASTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
FASTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from FAORRES in a standard format or standard units. FASTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in FASTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in FAORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning; they could be represented in standard format in FASTRESC as "NEGATIVE".

FASTRESN.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
FASTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from FASTRESC. FASTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

FASTRESU.label: Standard Units
FASTRESU.description: Standardized unit used for FASTRESC and FASTRESN.

FASTAT.label: Completion Status
FASTAT.description: Used to indicate that the measurement was not done. Should be null if a result exists in FAORRES.

FAREASND.label: Reason Not Performed
FAREASND.description: Describes why a question was not answered. Example: "Subject refused". Used in conjunction with FASTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

FALOC.label: Location of the Finding About
FALOC.description: Used to specify the location of the clinical evaluation. Example: "ARM".

FALAT.label: Laterality
FALAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".

FALOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
FALOBXFL.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

FABLFL.label: Baseline Flag
FABLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null. Note that FABLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

FAEVAL.label: Evaluator
FAEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain collected or derived data. Examples: "INVESTIGATOR", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "VENDOR".

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: 1. Clinical encounter number. \n 2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: 1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. \n 2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time of the observation. Examples: "SCREENING", "TREATMENT", "FOLLOW-UP".

FADTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
FADTC.description: Collection date and time of findings assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format.

FADY.label: Study Day of Collection
