FADY.description: 1. Study day of collection, measured as integer days. \n 2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

SRSEQ.label: Sequence Number
SRSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

SRGRPID.label: Group ID
SRGRPID.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.

SRREFID.label: Reference ID
SRREFID.description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: "Specimen ID".

SRTESTCD.label: Skin Response Test or Exam Short Name
SRTESTCD.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in SRTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in SRTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). SRTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.

SRTEST.label: Skin Response Test or Examination Name
SRTEST.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in SRTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Wheal Diameter".

SROBJ.label: Object of the Observation
SROBJ.description: Used to describe the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by --TEST. Examples: the dose of the immunogenic material or the allergen associated with the response (e.g., "Johnson Grass IgE 0.15 BAU mL").

SRCAT.label: Category for Test
SRCAT.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values across subjects.

SRSCAT.label: Subcategory for Test
SRSCAT.description: A further categorization of SRCAT values.

SRORRES.label: Results or Findings in Original Units
SRORRES.description: Results of measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

SRORRESU.label: Original Units
SRORRESU.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for SRORRES. Example: "mm".

SRSTRESC.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SRSTRESC.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from SRORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. SRSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in SRSTRESN.

SRSTRESN.label: Numeric Results/Findings in Std. Units
SRSTRESN.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from SRSTRESC. SRSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.

SRSTRESU.label: Standard Units
SRSTRESU.description: Standardized units used for SRSTRESC and SRSTRESN. Example: "mm".

SRSTAT.label: Completion Status
SRSTAT.description: Used to indicate exam not done. Should be null if a result exists in SRORRES.

SRREASND.label: Reason Not Done
SRREASND.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Used in conjunction with SRSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

SRNAM.label: Vendor Name
SRNAM.description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor who provided the test results.

SRSPEC.label: Specimen Type
SRSPEC.description: Defines the types of specimen used for a measurement. Example: "SKIN".

SRLOC.label: Location Used for Measurement
SRLOC.description: Location relevant to the collection of the measurement.

SRLAT.label: Laterality
SRLAT.description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing laterality of intervention administration. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".

SRMETHOD.label: Method of Test or Examination
SRMETHOD.description: Method of test or examination. Examples: "ELISA", "EIA", "MICRONEUTRALIZATION ASSAY", "PLAQUE REDUCTION NEUTRALIZATION ASSAY".

SRLOBXFL.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SRLOBXFL.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.

SRBLFL.label: Baseline Flag
SRBLFL.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null. Note that SRBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.

SREVAL.label: Evaluator
SREVAL.description: Role of person who provided evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain collected or derived data. Examples: "INVESTIGATOR", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "VENDOR".

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the date/time of the observation. Examples: "SCREENING", "TREATMENT", and "FOLLOW-UP".

SRDTC.label: Date/Time of Collection
SRDTC.description: Collection date and time of an observation represented in ISO 8601.

SRDY.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SRDY.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to sponsor- defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

SRTPT.label: Planned Time Point Name
SRTPT.description: Text description of time when measurement should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See SRTPTNUM and SRTPTREF. Examples: "START", "5 MIN POST".

SRTPTNUM.label: Planned Time Point Number
SRTPTNUM.description: Numerical version of SRTPT to aid in sorting.

SRELTM.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SRELTM.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a fixed time point reference (SRTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by SRTPTREF.

SRTPTREF.label: Time Point Reference
SRTPTREF.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by SRELTM, SRTPTNUM, and SRTPT. Example: "INTRADERMAL INJECTION".

SRRFTDTC.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SRRFTDTC.description: Date/time of the reference time point, SRTPTREF.

RDOMAIN.label: Related Domain Abbreviation
RDOMAIN.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s). Null for comments collected on a general comments or additional information CRF page.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

COSEQ.label: Sequence Number
COSEQ.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

IDVAR.label: Identifying Variable
IDVAR.description: Identifying variable in the parent dataset that identifies the record(s) to which the comment applies. Examples AESEQ or CMGRPID. Used only when individual comments are related to domain records. Null for comments collected on separate CRFs.

IDVARVAL.label: Identifying Variable Value
IDVARVAL.description: Value of identifying variable of the parent record(s). Used only when individual comments are related to domain records. Null for comments collected on separate CRFs.

COREF.label: Comment Reference
COREF.description: Sponsor-defined reference associated with the comment. May be the CRF page number (e.g., 650), or a module name (e.g., DEMOG), or a combination of information that identifies the reference (e.g. 650-VITALS-VISIT 2).

COVAL.label: Comment
COVAL.description: The text of the comment. Text over 200 characters can be added to additional columns COVAL1-COVALn. See Assumption 3.

COEVAL.label: Evaluator
COEVAL.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Example: "INVESTIGATOR".

COEVALID.label: Evaluator Identifier
COEVALID.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in --EVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST", "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2".

CODTC.label: Date/Time of Comment
CODTC.description: Date/time of comment on dedicated comment form. Should be null if this is a child record of another domain or if comment date was not collected.

CODY.label: Study Day of Comment
CODY.description: Study day of the comment, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. This must be a unique value, and could be a compound identifier formed by concatenating STUDYID-SITEID-SUBJID.

SUBJID.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
SUBJID.description: Subject identifier, which must be unique within the study. Often the ID of the subject as recorded on a CRF.

RFSTDTC.label: Subject Reference Start Date/Time
RFSTDTC.description: Reference start date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 character format. Usually equivalent to date/time when subject was first exposed to study treatment. See assumption 9 for additional detail on when RFSTDTC may be null.

RFENDTC.label: Subject Reference End Date/Time
RFENDTC.description: Reference end date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 character format. Usually equivalent to the date/time when subject was determined to have ended the trial, and often equivalent to date/time of last exposure to study treatment. Required for all randomized subjects; null for screen failures or unassigned subjects.

RFXSTDTC.label: Date/Time of First Study Treatment
RFXSTDTC.description: First date/time of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the earliest value of EXSTDTC.

RFXENDTC.label: Date/Time of Last Study Treatment
RFXENDTC.description: Last date/time of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the latest value of EXENDTC (or the latest value of EXSTDTC if EXENDTC was not collected or is missing).

RFCSTDTC.label: Date/Time of First Challenge Agent Admin
RFCSTDTC.description: Used only when protocol specifies a challenge agent to induce a condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent. Equal to the earliest value of AGSTDTC for the challenge agent.

RFCENDTC.label: Date/Time of Last Challenge Agent Admin
RFCENDTC.description: Used only when protocol specifies a challenge agent to induce a condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent. Equal to the latest value of AGENDTC for the challenge agent (or the latest value of AGSTDTC if AGENDTC was not collected or is missing).

RFICDTC.label: Date/Time of Informed Consent
RFICDTC.description: Date/time of informed consent in ISO 8601 character format. This will be the same as the date of informed consent in the Disposition domain, if that protocol milestone is documented. Would be null only in studies not collecting the date of informed consent.

RFPENDTC.label: Date/Time of End of Participation
RFPENDTC.description: Date/time when subject ended participation or follow-up in a trial, as defined in the protocol, in ISO 8601 character format. Should correspond to the last known date of contact. Examples include completion date, withdrawal date, last follow-up, date recorded for lost to follow up, and death date.

DTHDTC.label: Date/Time of Death
DTHDTC.description: Date/time of death for any subject who died, in ISO 8601 format. Should represent the date/time that is captured in the clinical-trial database.

DTHFL.label: Subject Death Flag
DTHFL.description: Indicates the subject died. Should be "Y" or null. Should be populated even when the death date is unknown.

SITEID.label: Study Site Identifier
SITEID.description: Unique identifier for a site within a study.

INVID.label: Investigator Identifier
INVID.description: An identifier to describe the Investigator for the study. May be used in addition to SITEID. Not needed if SITEID is equivalent to INVID.

INVNAM.label: Investigator Name
INVNAM.description: Name of the investigator for a site.

BRTHDTC.label: Date/Time of Birth
BRTHDTC.description: Date/time of birth of the subject.

AGE.label: Age
AGE.description: Age expressed in AGEU. May be derived from RFSTDTC and BRTHDTC, but BRTHDTC may not be available in all cases (due to subject privacy concerns).

RACE.label: Race
RACE.description: Race of the subject. Sponsors should refer to the FDA guidance2 regarding the collection of race. See assumption below regarding RACE.

ETHNIC.label: Ethnicity
ETHNIC.description: The ethnicity of the subject. Sponsors should refer to the FDA guidance1 regarding the collection of ethnicity.

ARMCD.label: Planned Arm Code
ARMCD.description: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters. It is not subject to the character restrictions that apply to TESTCD. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a 7-period crossover were constructed using 2-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20. If the subject was not assigned to a trial arm, ARMCD is null and ARMNRS is populated. \n With the exception of studies which use multistage arm assignments, must be a value of ARMCD in the Trial Arms dataset.

ARM.label: Description of Planned Arm
ARM.description: Name of the arm to which the subject was assigned. If the subject was not assigned to an arm, ARM is null and ARMNRS is populated. \n With the exception of studies which use multistage arm assignments, must be a value of ARM in the Trial Arms dataset.

ACTARMCD.label: Actual Arm Code
ACTARMCD.description: Code of actual arm. ACTARMCD is limited to 20 characters. It is not subject to the character restrictions that apply to TESTCD. The maximum length of ACTARMCD is longer than for other short variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. \n With the exception of studies which use multistage arm assignments, must be a value of ARMCD in the Trial Arms dataset. \n If the subject was not assigned to an arm or followed a course not described by any planned arm, ACTARMCD is null and ARMNRS is populated.

ACTARM.label: Description of Actual Arm
ACTARM.description: Description of actual arm. \n With the exception of studies which use multistage arm assignments, must be a value of ARM in the Trial Arms dataset. \n If the subject was not assigned to an arm or followed a course not described by any planned arm, ACTARM is null and ARMNRS is populated.

ARMNRS.label: Reason Arm and/or Actual Arm is Null
ARMNRS.description: A coded reason that arm variables (ARM and ARMCD) and/or actual arm variables (ACTARM and ACTARMCD) are null. Examples: "SCREEN FAILURE", "NOT ASSIGNED", "ASSIGNED, NOT TREATED", "UNPLANNED TREATMENT". It is assumed that if the arm and actual arm variables are null, the same reason applies to both arm and actual arm.

ACTARMUD.label: Description of Unplanned Actual Arm
ACTARMUD.description: A description of actual treatment for a subject who did not receive treatment described in a planned trial arm.

COUNTRY.label: Country
COUNTRY.description: Country of the investigational site in which the subject participated in the trial. \n \n Generally represented using ISO 3166-1 Alpha-3. Note that regulatory agency specific requirements (e.g., US FDA) may require other terminologies; in such cases, follow regulatory requirements.

DMDY.label: Study Day of Collection
DMDY.description: Study day of collection measured as integer days.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

SESEQ.label: Sequence Number
SESEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. Should be assigned to be consistent chronological order.

ETCD.label: Element Code
ETCD.description: 1. ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name. \n 2. If an encountered element differs from the planned element to the point that it is considered a new element, then use "UNPLAN" as the value for ETCD to represent this element.

ELEMENT.label: Description of Element
ELEMENT.description: The name of the element. If ETCD has a value of "UNPLAN", then ELEMENT should be null.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the subject's assigned trial arm.

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Epoch associated with the element in the planned sequence of elements for the arm to which the subject was assigned.

SESTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Element
SESTDTC.description: Start date/time for an element for each subject.

SEENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Element
SEENDTC.description: End date/time for an element for each subject.

SESTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Element
SESTDY.description: Study day of start of element relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

SEENDY.label: Study Day of End of Element
SEENDY.description: Study day of end of element relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

SEUPDES.label: Description of Unplanned Element
SEUPDES.description: Description of what happened to the subject during an unplanned element. Used only if ETCD has the value of "UNPLAN".

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

SMSEQ.label: Sequence Number
SMSEQ.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of subject records. Should be assigned to be consistent chronological order.

MIDS.label: Disease Milestone Instance Name
MIDS.description: Name of the specific disease milestone. For types of disease milestones that can occur multiple times, the name will end with a sequence number. Example: "HYPO1".

MIDSTYPE.label: Disease Milestone Type
MIDSTYPE.description: The type of disease milestone. Example: "HYPOGLYCEMIC EVENT".

SMSTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Milestone
SMSTDTC.description: Start date/time of milestone instance (if milestone is an intervention or event) or date of milestone (if Milestone is a finding).

SMENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Milestone
SMENDTC.description: End date/time of disease milestone instance.

SMSTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Milestone
SMSTDY.description: Study day of start of disease milestone instance, relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

SMENDY.label: Study Day of End of Milestone
SMENDY.description: Study day of end of disease milestone instance, relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.

DOMAIN.label: Domain Abbreviation
DOMAIN.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain most relevant to the observation. The domain abbreviation is also used as a prefix for variables to ensure uniqueness when datasets are merged.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.

SVPRESP.label: Pre-specified
SVPRESP.description: Used to indicate whether the visit was planned (i.e., visits specified in the TV domain). Value is "Y" for planned visits, null for unplanned visits.

SVOCCUR.label: Occurrence
SVOCCUR.description: Used to record whether a planned visit occurred. The value is null for unplanned visits.

SVREASOC.label: Reason for Occur Value
SVREASOC.description: The reason for the value in SVOCCUR. If SVOCCUR="N", SVREASOC is the reason the visit did not occur.

SVCNTMOD.label: Contact Mode
SVCNTMOD.description: The way in which the visit was conducted. Examples: "IN PERSON", "TELEPHONE CALL", "IVRS".

SVEPCHGI.label: Epi/Pandemic Related Change Indicator
SVEPCHGI.description: Indicates whether the visit was changed due to an epidemic or pandemic.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.

SVSTDTC.label: Start Date/Time of Observation
SVSTDTC.description: Start date/time of an observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.

SVENDTC.label: End Date/Time of Observation
SVENDTC.description: End date/time of the observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.

SVSTDY.label: Study Day of Start of Observation
SVSTDY.description: Actual study day of start of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

SVENDY.label: Study Day of End of Observation
SVENDY.description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.

SVUPDES.label: Description of Unplanned Visit
SVUPDES.description: Description of what happened to the subject during an unplanned visit. Only populated for unplanned visits.

ARMCD.label: Planned Arm Code
ARMCD.description: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than that for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a 7-period crossover were constructed using 2-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20.

ARM.label: Description of Planned Arm
ARM.description: Name given to an arm or treatment group.

TAETORD.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
TAETORD.description: Number that gives the order of the element within the arm.

ETCD.label: Element Code
ETCD.description: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name.

ELEMENT.label: Description of Element
ELEMENT.description: The name of the element. The same element may occur more than once within an arm.

TABRANCH.label: Branch
TABRANCH.description: Condition subject met, at a "branch" in the trial design at the end of this element, to be included in this arm (e.g., "Randomization to DRUG X").

TATRANS.label: Transition Rule
TATRANS.description: If the trial design allows a subject to transition to an element other than the next element in sequence, then the conditions for transitioning to those other elements, and the alternative element sequences, are specified in this rule (e.g., "Responders go to washout").

EPOCH.label: Epoch
EPOCH.description: Name of the trial epoch with which this element of the arm is associated.

TDORDER.label: Sequence of Planned Assessment Schedule
TDORDER.description: A number given to ensure ordinal sequencing of the planned assessment schedules within a trial.

TDANCVAR.label: Anchor Variable Name
TDANCVAR.description: A reference to the date variable name that provides the start point from which the planned disease assessment schedule is measured. This must be a referenced from the ADaM ADSL dataset (e.g., "ANCH1DT"). Note: TDANCVAR will contain the name of a reference date variable.

TDSTOFF.label: Offset from the Anchor
TDSTOFF.description: A fixed offset from the date provided by the variable referenced in TDANCVAR. This is used when the timing of planned cycles does not start on the exact day referenced in the variable indicated in TDANCVAR. The value of this variable will be either zero or a positive value and will be represented in ISO 8601 character format.

TDTGTPAI.label: Planned Assessment Interval
TDTGTPAI.description: The planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format.

TDMINPAI.label: Planned Assessment Interval Minimum
TDMINPAI.description: The lower limit of the allowed range for the planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format.

TDMAXPAI.label: Planned Assessment Interval Maximum
TDMAXPAI.description: The upper limit of the allowed range for the planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format.

TDNUMRPT.label: Maximum Number of Actual Assessments
TDNUMRPT.description: This variable must represent the maximum number of actual assessments for the analysis that this disease assessment schedule describes. In a trial where the maximum number of assessments is not defined explicitly in the protocol (e.g., assessments occur until death), TDNUMRPT should represent the maximum number of disease assessments that support the efficacy analysis encountered by any subject across the trial at that point in time.

ETCD.label: Element Code
ETCD.description: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name.

TEENRL.label: Rule for End of Element
TEENRL.description: Describes condition for ending element. Either TEENRL or TEDUR must be present for each element.

TEDUR.label: Planned Duration of Element
TEDUR.description: Planned duration of element in ISO 8601 format. Used when the rule for ending the element is applied after a fixed duration.

IETESTCD.label: Incl/Excl Criterion Short Name
IETESTCD.description: Short name IETEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in IETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). IETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. The prefix "IE" is used to ensure consistency with the IE domain.

IETEST.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion
IETEST.description: Full text of the inclusion or exclusion criterion. The prefix "IE" is used to ensure consistency with the IE domain.

IECAT.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Category
IECAT.description: Used for categorization of the inclusion or exclusion criteria.

IESCAT.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Subcategory
IESCAT.description: A further categorization of the exception criterion. Can be used to distinguish criteria for a sub-study or to categorize as major or minor exceptions. Examples: "MAJOR", "MINOR".

TIRL.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion Rule
TIRL.description: Rule that expresses the criterion in computer-executable form. See Assumption 4.

TIVERS.label: Protocol Criteria Versions
TIVERS.description: The number of this version of the Inclusion/Exclusion criteria. May be omitted if there is only 1 version.

DOMAIN.label: Domain Abbreviation
DOMAIN.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain, which must be TM.

MIDSTYPE.label: Disease Milestone Type
MIDSTYPE.description: The type of disease milestone. Example: "HYPOGLYCEMIC EVENT".

TMRPT.label: Disease Milestone Repetition Indicator
TMRPT.description: Indicates whether this is a disease milestone that can occur only once ("N") or a type of disease milestone that can occur multiple times ("Y").

TSSEQ.label: Sequence Number
TSSEQ.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a parameter. Allows inclusion of multiple records for the same TSPARMCD.

TSGRPID.label: Group ID
TSGRPID.description: Used to tie together a group of related records.

TSPARMCD.label: Trial Summary Parameter Short Name
TSPARMCD.description: TSPARMCD (the companion to TSPARM) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that TSPARMCD will need to serve as variable names. Examples: "AGEMIN", "AGEMAX".

TSPARM.label: Trial Summary Parameter
TSPARM.description: Term for the trial summary parameter. The value in TSPARM cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Planned Minimum Age of Subjects", "Planned Maximum Age of Subjects".

TSVAL.label: Parameter Value
TSVAL.description: Value of TSPARM. Example: "ASTHMA" when TSPARM value is "Trial Indication". TSVAL can only be null when TSVALNF is populated. Text over 200 characters can be added to additional columns TSVAL1-TSVALn. See Assumption 8.

TSVALNF.label: Parameter Value Null Flavor
TSVALNF.description: Null flavor for the value of TSPARM, to be populated only if TSVAL is null.

TSVALCD.label: Parameter Value Code
TSVALCD.description: This is the code of the term in TSVAL. For example, "6CW7F3G59X" is the code for gabapentin; "C49488" is the code for Y. The length of this variable can be longer than 8 to accommodate the length of the external terminology.

TSVCDREF.label: Name of the Reference Terminology
TSVCDREF.description: The name of the reference terminology from which TSVALCD is taken. For example; CDISC CT, SNOMED, ISO 8601.

TSVCDVER.label: Version of the Reference Terminology
TSVCDVER.description: The version number of the reference terminology, if applicable.

VISITNUM.label: Visit Number
VISITNUM.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.

VISIT.label: Visit Name
VISIT.description: Description of clinical encounter. This is often defined in the protocol. Used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY as a text description of the clinical encounter.

VISITDY.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
VISITDY.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Due to its sequential nature, used for sorting.

ARMCD.label: Planned Arm Code
ARMCD.description: 1. ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a 7-period crossover were constructed using 2-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20. \n 2. If the timing of visits for a trial does not depend on which arm a subject is in, then ARMCD should be null.

ARM.label: Description of Planned Arm
ARM.description: 1. Name given to an arm or treatment group. \n 2. If the timing of visits for a trial does not depend on which arm a subject is in, then Arm should be left blank.

TVSTRL.label: Visit Start Rule
TVSTRL.description: Rule describing when the visit starts, in relation to the sequence of elements.

TVENRL.label: Visit End Rule
TVENRL.description: Rule describing when the visit ends, in relation to the sequence of elements.

NHOID.label: Non-host Organism Identifier
NHOID.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism. NHOID should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the organism as reported by the lab. It must be unique for each unique organism as defined by the specific values of the organism's entire known taxonomy described by pairs of OIPARMCD and OIVAL .

OISEQ.label: Sequence Number
OISEQ.description: Sequence number to given to ensure uniqueness within a parameter within an organism (NHOID) within dataset.

OIPARMCD.label: Non-host Organism ID Element Short Name
OIPARMCD.description: Short name of the taxon being described. Examples: "GROUP", "GENTYP", "SUBTYP".

OIPARM.label: Non-host Organism ID Element Name
OIPARM.description: Name of the taxon being described. Examples: "Group", "Genotype", "Subtype".

OIVAL.label: Non-host Organism ID Element Value
OIVAL.description: Value for the taxon in OIPARMCD/OIPARM for the organism identified by NHOID.

RDOMAIN.label: Related Domain Abbreviation
RDOMAIN.description: Abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s).

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

IDVAR.label: Identifying Variable
IDVAR.description: Name of the identifying variable in the general-observation-class dataset that identifies the related record(s). Examples: --SEQ, --GRPID.

IDVARVAL.label: Identifying Variable Value
IDVARVAL.description: Value of identifying variable described in IDVAR. If --SEQ is the variable being used to describe this record, then the value of --SEQ would be entered here.

RELTYPE.label: Relationship Type
RELTYPE.description: Identifies the hierarchical level of the records in the relationship. Values should be either "ONE" or "MANY". Used only when identifying a relationship between datasets (as described in Section 8.3, Relating Datasets).

RELID.label: Relationship Identifier
RELID.description: Unique value within USUBJID that identifies the relationship. All records for the same USUBJID that have the same RELID are considered related/associated. RELID can be any value the sponsor chooses, and is only meaningful within the RELREC dataset to identify the related/associated domain records.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.

SPEC.label: Specimen Type
SPEC.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "SERUM", "PLASMA", "URINE", "SOFT TISSUE".

PARENT.label: Specimen Parent
PARENT.description: Identifies the REFID of the parent of a specimen to support tracking its genealogy.

LEVEL.label: Specimen Level
LEVEL.description: Identifies the generation number of the sample where the collected sample is considered the first generation.

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. Either USUBJID or POOLID must be populated.

POOLID.label: Pool Identifier
POOLID.description: Identifier used to identify a pool of subjects. If POOLID is entered, POOLDEF records must exist for each subject in the pool and USUBJID must be null. Either USUBJID or POOLID must be populated.

RSUBJID.label: Related Subject or Pool Identifier
RSUBJID.description: Identifier used to identify a related subject or pool of subjects. RSUBJID will be populated with either the USUBJID of the related subject or the POOLID of the related pool.

SREL.label: Subject Relationship
SREL.description: Describes the relationship of the subject identified in USUBJID or the pool identified in POOLID to the subject or pool identified in RSUBJID.

STUDYID.label: Study Identifier
STUDYID.description: Study identifier of the parent record(s).

RDOMAIN.label: Related Domain Abbreviation
RDOMAIN.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s).

USUBJID.label: Unique Subject Identifier
USUBJID.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. This is the value of USUBJID in the parent record(s).

IDVAR.label: Identifying Variable
IDVAR.description: Identifying variable in the dataset that identifies the related record(s). Examples: --SEQ, --GRPID.

IDVARVAL.label: Identifying Variable Value
IDVARVAL.description: Value of identifying variable of the parent record(s).

QNAM.label: Qualifier Variable Name
QNAM.description: The short name of the qualifier variable, which is used as a column name in a domain view with data from the parent domain. The value in QNAM cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). QNAM cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. This will often be the column name in the sponsor's operational dataset.

QLABEL.label: Qualifier Variable Label
QLABEL.description: This is the long name or label associated with QNAM. The value in QLABEL cannot be longer than 40 characters. This will often be the column label in the sponsor's original dataset.

QVAL.label: Data Value
QVAL.description: Result of, response to, or value associated with QNAM. A value for this column is required; no records can be in SUPP-- with a null value for QVAL.

QORIG.label: Origin
QORIG.description: Because QVAL can represent a mixture of collected (on a CRF), derived, or assigned items, QORIG is used to indicate the origin of this data. Examples: "CRF", "Assigned", "Derived". See Section 4.1.8, Origin Metadata.

QEVAL.label: Evaluator
QEVAL.description: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain objectively collected or derived data. Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "STATISTICIAN", "DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR", "CLINICAL COORDINATOR".
